Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 25 layer lasagna, So tasty!
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lots of different melted cheese with maybe something that looks like little round pastas. (About the size of couscous)

UxnQETBb_mnrMXe-9xS8Vg.text: Enjoyed a great dinner here with friends.  Started with an interesting take on calamari with squid ink batter, and transitioned to the Cesar salad for two, prepared tableside.  Our main courses included the cacio e pepe, and the garganelli, both created with fresh house made pasta.  Service was excellent, and the atmosphere was calm and casual, allowing for enjoyable conversation.   Overall very happy we tried this restaurant.

VIjPpd01Vn5bf5EhqoFbPg.text: An absolutely incredible restaurant, from food, to service, to ambiance.   We were looking for modern Italian for one of our nights in Scottsdale, and Fat Ox presented our ideal restaurant. With a modern-rustic-chic interior, this upscale restaurant welcomed you to some of the best dining in Arizona.   Practically every dish we ordered was a home run, including presentation. From a delicious Caesar salad made table-side, to fresh mozzarella, to handmade pastas. The ribeye and salmon were also favorites. I honestly don't have enough space to outline every dish, but  just know that everything you order, especially if you like it normally, will be incredible from the Fat Ox. I'm glad I came with a group of 6 so that I had the chance to try as much of the menu as possible!   Our waiter also truly elevated the meal even further. He struck the perfect balance between attentiveness, conversation, and impeccable and professional service. We chose every dish he recommended, and he kept our glasses of both water and wine full without us even noticing.   Overall an amazing meal! We will be back!

7mWYucl7tQv50v_isNbsJA.text: Beautiful new modern Italian restaurant with delicious food and wine. We shared the house salad which was wonderful, as well as some pastas (loved the Rigatoni).  One tip is that the vibe is very different in the lively main room (near the bar) vs. the back room (much quieter, more intimate) so worth asking for the ambience you prefer. It also looks like they have a great patio when the weather is good.

XuPjc2jOjtdmnqUbzWzlRw.text: This is a beautiful restaurant.  Indoor and outdoor seating.  Friendly greeting and excellent service.  Beyond that, the food is mediocre.  Almost every other Italian restaurant in the area has better food at much better prices.  The only thing on the menu I would recommend is the meatballs.  The wine list is extensive, but the least expensive red wine on the menu is $50.  If you want to dine in a great setting, get great service and don't care about the food, this is the place for you.  Just another celebrity chef boosting prices based on notoriety and serving very mediocre food.  Very disappointing $200 dinner for two.

KmrhUtV_ZnOZkptwlOoq6w.text: It is really hard for me to give such a beautiful place with great, attentive staff this rating. To first elaborate on the positives of the restaurant....it's gorgeous. Beautifully lit space with glass walls you can see into the restaurant through. There are various rooms too that look perfect for a nice private dining occasion or group gathering. It definitely looks like a place to impress a first date or celebrate any romantic occasion. The staff again was attentive and knowledgeable- they didn't hover but were effortlessly providing great service never letting our wine glasses or water go empty. Regarding my allergy they made me feel like anything i was interested in they could find a way to give it to me modified so I would be safe. The food gave me no issues and I felt very comfortable in that respect and I genuinely appreciated it. We ordered the linguine that comes with a pork meat sauce and the scallops. I don't think I've ever had scallops at a restaurant that I disliked and the fact that this dish cost about $35 I was shocked at just how bad it was. Scallops usually come in a small portion so that was as expected... (although I'd love a restaurant to surprise me once) and they came with mushrooms and what appeared to be brussel sprout leaves and dots of a dark burgundy sauce. My first bite I was pulling things out of my mouth ...that's how off putting the texture was. The brussel sprouts leaves were burnt and chewy ...the scallops had no flavor that I could tell. Tried the sauce which tasted like bbq perhaps? But made absolutely no sense with the scallops or anything else on the plate. I was honestly so let down...$35!? then the linguine came which upset me at a glance just due to the portion...imagine twirling your fork into a big bowl of pasta, take that fork and put it on a plate - that was the serving size (okay a little bigger but you understand). The pasta itself - great! Good flavor and unique - marinara but it had a fresh almost lemon or something fresh taste and that made it more sad that it was pretty much gone in 2 bites. I left starving - and with tip spent about $128 (including a bottle of prosecco that was average priced). It was very very disappointing. I don't think it's right that a restaurant charges so much for pasta and gives you a ridiculous portion. Or charges so much for any dish and doesn't deliver on taste. I've been twice now and the price just blows me out of the water for the either mediocre food or the small portions. I'm willing to pay for great food but I think it's insane to pay close to $130 anywhere and leave hungry (I genuinely went home and ate pasta there). It's a shame because the staff and ambiance are incredible. I hate to say I wouldn't go back.

mLtCzM6v_lBqQy4JCHYQCA.text: I'm being kind with this review. If I were reacting purely on my instinct as I left. I would give one star. Once again, I'm being generous in this review.   Interior, decor, lighting. 4 stars.   The rest...well... We were sat promptly. Our server arrived quickly. Took drink orders. Awesome. Everyone (including a bottle of wine, martini, beer) all arrived within 15 mins. Seemed long given the restaurant was 40% full (once again being kind). My glass of wine. Glass of wine on the wine by the glass menu. Tick tock. Tick tock. Appetizers hello. How are you? Mr. burrata, what happened? Where is the rest of you? 4 small fig halves for 6 people, and literally a dollop of daisy size burrata. Ummm where's my glass of wine. Super fun watching the rest of the party enjoying cocktails and wine. Server? Beep beep? Finally random person finally brings my glass of wine. Doesn't it all come from the same place?  Whatever, I'm just happy to receive my first glass of wine as the rest of my party is ordering their second.  I'll move along, make this as quick as possible. The swordfish is overcooked, and the size of a poached egg. Pared with what appeared and tasted like frozen spinach, bell pepper and kale. The scallops were more of a appetizer portion. Short ribs may of possibly been the best out of the bunch but still fall short.  Fat Ox is just another sad attempt to oversaturate Scottsdale. The flavors and potions do not justify the price. My purse got a napkin. But still sat on the floor. With tip. $700 Pricetag. And we all needed to get food our way home. Look forward to what takes their place in a year.

IEKwgKT06rntojz_HOMkjA.text: greeting staff was terrific, decor well done, noise level is far too high to be able to communicate at our table. service time very slow, meals not served at the same time. food was ok, expensive and very small portions. no one was happy with our dinner. i have spoken to several other friends who had similar poor experiences at this restaurant. we expected better.  lots of great restaurants around

dgIi730Mah6jrCLJWlAarg.text: I do not understand the negative reviews of this place. My husband and I went here last night to celebrate his birthday and it was honestly one of the best meals that we have ever had. Granted, this place has quite a scene starting at around 8 o'clock on a Saturday evening but it ends pretty quickly. If you can get beyond the half-dressed women and their ridiculous male counterparts that only Scottsdale provides I think that you'll find that this place is actually fantastic. We started with cocktails which word delicious-some of the best that we've ever had. For food we started with the Buffalo mozzarella which had a delicious citrus flavor and progressed to the lamb Ragu which is a must try and the butternut squash ravioli which had flavors that were totally unique. While the portion size of the pastas could have been larger our waitress Amanda was attentive and knowledgeable and guided us appropriately through the menu including the wine list which she knew perfectly. She recommended a bottle of nebiolo which was affordable and fantastic! Apparently you can make a reservation and request a waitress-- I would highly recommend requesting Amanda she was honestly wonderful. For our main course we had the half chicken which was totally unique and delicious and the salmon which was cooked perfectly. They generously recognized my husband's birthday by providing us a dessert on the house, a delicious tiramisu that we devoured. Again it was an absolutely fantastic evening. There's nothing that I would change about this place. If you have time to have a relaxed dinner and you're going out for special occasion I would give this place a try. It's very special.

mLL81WpYS7ulTerkTaow3w.text: Disappointing! The front staff is great and the ambience is really nice. And that's all the great things that you're going to experience. We ordered a Caesar salad, which was very bland. Nothing like you would expect a Caesar salad to be.  We ordered the Buratta, and a couple of pastas that were okay. Nothing worth the price of them. We then ordered the filet steak, which tasted like it was burnt, and honestly I feel you could get a better cut of meat from whole foods than this place. With our state came out of side which our waiter never told us about and it tasted like vomit. By this point we were hoping the desserts would be so good that it may make up for the meal. Unfortunately we were wrong. We ordered the olive oil cake and the tiramisu. The olive oil cake had way too much orange flavor to it and the tiramisu was more of a chocolate brownie on the bottom with a cheesecake layering on top then a traditional Italian tiramisu. Then we ordered some cappuccinos and after one and a half sips we were done. I asked the waiter did we order espresso's, he said no they were cappuccinos. The service we got was very poor, they don't tell you about sides to meals and their overall guidance for you for the evening for your first time there is very underwhelming. All in all we will not be returning, even if they paid us to come back! Extremely disappointed, and avoid this place and make the better decision to have True Italian food, because this place does not serve anything like Italy has. Founder must have been drinking too much wine to remember what Italian food should be like. Avoid this place!

c2wmP7E7PWHHQBAo0BRX9w.text: The food was exquisite, absolutely phenomenal.  We're in town for a week and are planning a second visit tomorrow or the next day because our first was so good. I highly recommend the pasta, we ordered two and they were both exceptional as we're the mussels and ricotta. One of the best Italian meals I have had outside of Italy.

KpQlXPRhfVFjwKhsDe7Xtw.text: Zinc Bistro is my hands down favorite restaurant in town so I was really, really looking forward to loving Fat Ox. To me, it was really unmemorable and to be honest, vaguely Italian in comparison to Zinc's on point rendition of a 7th arrondisement brasserie. Incredibly loud and super dark even for me and I love good high energy restaurant as much as the next 30 something Scottsdale chick. Way too much meat on the menu - salmon as the only option for fish eating folk? Salmon is the new chicken these days. Portions didn't make sense - mussels starter could have fed 6 people, but two teaspoons of burrata was barely enough for everyone at our table to have a lick. Perhaps I'll try this again in the future as a girlfriend's lunch spot, as lunch is what Zinc really nails for me, but for now its a pass. Bummer.

6T6-cYaLFyAsebT218ndHA.text: Simply amazing food, service was superb, and ambience was perfect! We had a late night dinner on a Sunday night. Our server answered all of our questions, made the perfect recommendations and our meal was delicious! I would highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion or just a nice weeknight dinner. Well done Fat Ox!

FJYtszrt05LjgxQYt_laOg.text: Being Italian and from New Jersey, I've been to many wonderful Italian restaurants in my life, but Fat Ox was an original  gastronomic experience for sure! I had never tasted prosciutto that was so tender. Squid ink pappardelle with laughing bird shrimp and calamari had more flavor than seems legal. The Garganellii pasta with speck was out of this world. And don't even get me started on the amazingly tender scallops that melted like butter in my mouth. Elijah Davis was working the room and made a Caesar salad that just oozed of his showmanship and love. He made the whole night so special! And our waiter Richie and the manager Darva went out of their way as well and made us feel like VIPs. When Elijah insisted on coffee and dessert I thought I would explode but it was well worth it! Again the BEST tiramisu I have ever eaten. Even the bread with the whipped ricotta and cheesy butter was a special touch. An hour spent after dinner enjoying a top-quality bourbon at the bar with bartender Britney was a most pleasant way to top off a great evening. She is a pleasure to chat with. Run, don't walk, to Fat Ox when you want a meal and an evening that will surely stand out in your memory. And if you're lucky, Elijah Davis will be working that night and amaze you!

VVUrCwqG7GHrrqNUXYiy1Q.text: Before Fat Ox's much acclaimed open, I called for a reservation for my party of 8. A few days before our dinner, I personally went to the Fat Ox and requested the large table in the back room as it was quieter. I also told the hostess when she called to confirm my reservation that I wanted the back room. Arriving on time for our reservation, our party was given a table in the noisy bar area. Although they were able to give us a table that was located more in the dining room, it was not what I requested not once, not twice, but three times. We were off to a shaky start. As far as the food...we were encouraged by our server to do a family style way of dining on the different courses. The four women of the group decided on our first course of a caeser salad. It was too lemony for my liking, as I enjoy more of a parmesan taste. The second course was the Casoncelli and Strozzapreti. As far as the family style of sharing, the four of us could have two tablespoons of Casoncelli (butternut squash) and two pasta noodles on the Strozzapreit (pasta and tomato sauch). Our entree that 3 of us split (one woman had the ligunine and clams, double portion as an entree) was the Skirt Steak Tagliata, which was presented pre sliced. We could each have two slices, one tablespoon of polenta and a two tablespoons of mushrooms. They were out of our requested tiramisu and comped us some other deserts.  The food is delicious; however the servers need to be clearer with their portion size. And to leave the restaurant feeling full, you will pay for that feeling. For the four of us, our caeser was $34, second course was $30 and the entrees were $38 and $36.  Will we come back? After the problem with the table, it's a bitter pill to swallow. But the food is delicious, but more managable if you go just as a couple portion-wise. ALso, if you are with a group, don't expect to hear anyone at the opposite end of the table. This place is busy and noisy.

2dzSJivVX6UZ1IM0XkGpIA.text: Wonderful food and drink menu! Definitely do check out the veal meatballs and the prosciutto. The cocktails are fantastic and Connor at the bar is phenomenal

VySZweZU6MJYj-0aNXh3hw.text: Great looking restaurant but very over priced for what you get. Only sat at the bar and was very disappointed in the food options. I'll probably go back, just not anytime soon.

ofLCX9j_QL_bSS0NneFC5w.text: Went there w/certain expectations (Matt Carter's impressive resume, an Italian restaurant, being in sctd, etc.). It is certainly good, well designed but very expensive & small portions for what you get. It's all about sctdl, the vibe, etc.

kZ2ot490nU4OyjUO-ynaFg.text: Ridiculously high priced.  Ridiculously small portions.  Ridiculously contrived menu items.  My husband and I, and two friends, dined at Fat Ox recently.   We spent $400 with only 3 glasses of wine, and left hungry!.   We were excited to dine at Fat Ox, being fans of The Mission, Zinc Burger and House Brasserie.    We arrived a few minutes early, and were asked to wait because they didn't have any menus!  The front reception area is chaotic, and the staff, of whom there are many, don't know what is going on.  Once seated, we ordered the Caesar salad.  The flavor was OK, but the portion size was tiny - 4 lettuce leaves.  We ordered a couple of pastas for the table, the tortellini and another pasta stuffed with salamis, etc.  When the orders arrived, our guests burst out laughing - they thought it was a joke.  5 teeny tiny tortellini. Flavors were bland.  The main courses were equally small, and, sadly, quite tasteless.  My husband ordered the 7 oz filet, which wasn't even 4 oz.  The scallops were an appetizer size.  The veal was a decent portion, but shockingly undercooked.   The bread basket consisted of large croutons.  When we asked for me, the server told us we would have to pay extra!  Yikes!!  Don't go!!!

mEgoLWTS0VKkNgE8BcI7JQ.text: This place is fantastic. It was not only excellent quality food, but very innovative. I had been warned it was pricey with small portions -- that was bad info. Friends from out of town had heard of it and wanted to go, so I arranged for a group of 12. We asked our server to make some selections, and I made clear I had heard it was pricey, so don't break the bank. We ate family style. The food was Fantastic. Great wine. We all had plenty to eat, and I was surprised it was significantly less than the bill for the same group at Mastro's a few nights before. I wonder if my server can remember us and tell me what he selected for us?

DwVsriy3E4YjhK5rYcGuBw.text: Came in to check out the Apertivo hour for a drink and a snack, but I was so impressed I ended up staying for dinner.  The pasta was the star of the meal, many unique dishes that can't be found anywhere else!! Loved the Rosso crest di Gallo and squid ink pappardelle, finished the meal off with the ribeye which was perfect to share with my date.  Flavor was amazing and left satisfied but not stuffed!!  Fantastic selection of wine and spirits and the cocktails were money.  We will definitely be back!!

hCYFQ0rOwj6chTh__WqT_Q.text: We had a wonderful experience at this new restaurant. Our server Aaron was excellent in describing the unique menu and even offered a pasta "on him" for us to try. And it was perfecto. We enjoyed the fried olives, Caesar salad, burrata appetizer, scallops and tomahawk pork. I highly recommend the Fat Ox.

rXB2zMUn7fBa6i8P3nWkTQ.text: Went to one of the opening events with a friend and was amazed!! As a devout carnivore, the ribeye and flank steak were straight out of my dreams. Seriously, the next time I am at that intersection and in need of steak perfection, pass on Flemings and head straight for the Fat Ox. Not to be out done, the pasta and apps were on point as well. The space is beautiful too. They also gave us a Lambrusco wine which is my new obsession. Finally, our server was so nice, he offered up to box up the bone on the ribeye for my dog!!! How nice! Great place. Cannot wait to go back!

6bL10VjRqYEKmQqYig8PBA.text: OK, the atmosphere was nice, a great bar scene, and the bartender, Tony, was great too.  This place has a good Friday night vibe, if not a little too noisy in the dining area.   The service in the dining room was good too, with the waiter and staff being attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.   And, the waiter did warn us that the portions were small.   I guess, given the healthy prices, I didn't think he meant THAT SMALL.   The pasta dishes were tasty, but very small.   I mean really, really small plates.  Specifically, the Casoncelli and Garganelli.   What really turned me off on this place though was the entree I ordered, the Costata.   This is a $65.00 grilled ribeye steak.   The menu says it is 18 oz.   It was not even close to that size.   Much smaller.  It came sliced up and was dressed up with peppers and onions, but it was a very small amount of edible meat.  There was a meatless bone, and the slices of beef were absurdly fatty.   I understand a ribeye can be a little fatty and that is part of why it tastes good, but this was way too fatty for my taste.   Bottom line, the food tastes good, but this place is way too expensive for what you get.

MYFUFsdCC2x5fG3WWQjOBQ.text: I celebrated my birthday at Fat Ox.  It was a wonderful experience and the food was excellent.  Our waiter, Cantenn, not only made our first visit to Fat Ox special, he celebrated my birthday as if I were part of the family.  It is a spendy restaurant but the service and food were worth the expense.  As we left, who I assume may have been the manager, he held the door open for my husband and me and wished me a Happy Birthday.  He was not a part of my direct wait staff so I was pleasantly surprised that he was so attentive to his customers, recognizing I was celebrating a birthday.  I would definitely go back and I would request Cantenn as our waiter.  I would recommend reservations!

94Idd3otHTP0nPjGIbkXXg.text: Wife and I dined here Saturday night for a nice evening out.  Absolutely loved the experience.  We were seated in the back room but the whole restaurant had a great ambiance about it.  Great energy of people enjoying their evenings.  Our server recommended some great wine from which to choose and we enjoyed thoroughly.  All the wait staff was attentive and pleasant, recommending dishes and drinks.  We started with the mussels in red sauce (amazing), next on to squid ink pasta, and finally on to our entrees - Branzino special and the bone-in ribeye.  Both were to die for.  The ribeye came sliced into several thick slabs and melted in your mouth.  We finished with the olive oil cake and left fantastically satisfied and not uncomfortable.  To top it off, I didn't feel the price was too much for the wonderful experience.  Will certainly be back !

bf9r8tbMJ5Rkr6wJda1LWA.text: My wife and I just dined here with good friends and I can say without reservation I would recommend Fat Ox to the many guests I come in contact with as a concierge. Jennifer and Isabel waited on us and we could not ask for more attentive service. The menu can be a little daunting and thankfully, Jennifer recommended courses that hit the mark in every instance. We began with a prosuitto and mushroom appetizer, followed up with rigatoni lamb verde, and finished with scallops accompanied by mushrooms and pancetta. As difficult as it was choosing from the many great looking course selections, choosing dessert was equally difficult. We settled on 3, the Tiramisu, Meyer Lemon Tart, and a special chocolate fudge concoction. Great look and feel to the dining area with an inviting patio. Will definitely return.

7LVsNWvfv0wGGZc4ZOzzhg.text: Swordfish for dinner. A great restaurant week selection of meal choices. My swordfish was very close to perfect - moist with an interesting bleak of flavors on the plate. My appetizer was a pasta dish I had never had before - and it was most enjoyable  The steak that my wife had was perfectly cooked to medium rare. Fortunately her portions were so large that we shared half of her steak the next morning as steak & eggs. Deserts were lovely and also excellent. I appreciated their by-the-glass wine selections. They offer an extensive selection of excellent Italian wines. I enjoyed s lovely Primitivo  A tad noisy when it filled to capacity / but what the heck - it was Friday night  If you want to give modern Italian a try the Fat Ice is the place to do so. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9p0tG2wXsm4T0eNHzjL3JA.text: Read about this place in Vogue of all spots, and it was great. It's definitely a fine dinning situation, but the quality of the food is amazing. Will be back soon.

pej1wLhBcqku92ZWGQsBow.text: Pretentiousness at its finest. I went here yesterday for happy hour. I made reservations FOR HAPPY HOUR, as the website appeared to allow this. I arrived 15 minutes prior to my 2 girlfriends, so I sat at the bar. For 10 minutes, the short, stocky bartender with facial hair ignored me; no greeting, no water, no menu...nothing. Accordingly, I went to the hostess stand and asked if I could be seated early, and without the rest of my party because the bartender wasn't interested in serving me. Oddly enough, I got no response to this bit of detail. I was seated though. After being seated I noticed that I didn't get a happy hour menu so I relayed my online reservation story. After which, a nice young man and nice young lady explained that happy hour was in the bar area only. I told the nice young lady that was odd because their website allowed me to make happy hour reservations. At any rate she found a table top for us in the bar area. The Margarita that I ordered was quite watered down and not tasty at all. The Tom Gore Cabernet Sauvignon was delicious. Then we ordered the burrata, the veal meatballs and the calamari. The burrata and veal meatballs were so tiny that the portions reminded me of tapas. Also, the calamari was very non-traditional (fried in black squid ink); our server did not warn us that it wasn't the traditional calamari. At any rate the food was good. Then, because of the small portion sizes, we ordered another round of different food. I had the Gigli pasta, delicious. THEN, the bill came...$136.07! Happy hour, for 3?? I don't think so.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gigli
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burrata, calamari &amp; veal meatballs
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kGfU6IAydkUPafHWBfds3Q.text: Not sure where to start...we had such an incredible experience here!  First the setting - indoor/outdoor. Perfect warm spring evening. The design is what I might call - modern bistro meets old school steak house. Chic, crisp, and at the same time it carried the old school accoutrements with some booths and the fine attention to detail...all the way down to the restrooms.  Oh, and the bar area had the key TV's showing the right sports action that the men in our group were hoping for. Second - the service. I'm not just taking about our waiter (who was a pro) but also his supporting staff were flawless, smiling all the time. We felt as welcome as if we were at my best friends house. In fact there were layers of supporting and managing staff who continued to look after every detail. Third - the food. Wow. Wow. Wow. Matt and his team in the kitchen turned out dish after dish of exquisite food prepared to order. We had half our table gluten free. They found a way to make essentially every dish gluten free as well (the ladies loved that!). And of course there were a few "this is on the chef" surprises which put it all over the top. We never felt rushed - even though I'm sure we took the table for much longer than they had anticipated.  Whether you are coming with your significant other or with a larger group - the Fat Ox will surpass your needs. Highly recommended. Highly!

B_sRr4u9olZ75AMCD_Gx3g.text: Amazing food and drinks! Loved every dish especially the jidori chicken.    Restaurant can get loud and crowded but well worth it!

jcFr6IAZJ6sUvQCN_F67yA.text: Booked our New Years Eve dinner here because we love this restaurant.  In addition, my husband's company booked a corporate event, which was a success.  However, when we experienced our New Year's Eve dinner, it was very disappointing.  We were enticed to consider an additional menu item on a fixed priced menu and were not told it was an additional up charge.  To our dismay, the up-charge was 125% above the fixed price.  Most certainly, this should have been disclosed and agreed upon.  In addition, the glass of Prosecco, that was included in the fixed menu, was actually nothing more than a taste.    Very disappointed on their deception to their guest on New Year's Eve!!!

vglDFZRFaH1PV-3AnEk3GQ.text: Happy Birthday Katie! Dinner was wonderful. The food and service were amazing. We tried a little bit of everything and shared. Can't wait to come back!

tmMGNGrad-GvNnPny5sWUg.text: Celebrated a special family birthday here Monday. Staff couldn't have been nicer, more accommodating or attentive. Food was excellent and the atmosphere perfect. A little pricey with a good bottle of wine, but well worth.  The occasional splurge.

mgff3JziQOtZmhJlAoRAmQ.text: My experience at the Fat Ox was a mixed bag of good, bad and just awful (I got food poisoning from their Scallops). The evening started out great, our server Eric was great and seemed attentive (initially), he walked us through the menu and gave some recommendations of what dishes were great and gave a couple cocktail recommendations. He took our order and then basically disappeared the entire evening outside of us flagging him down for a cocktail and the very very seldom "everything good" check-in. It kind of seemed like a lot of other staff were picking up his slack.  Per Eric's recommendation I tried the Navigation cocktail which is made with ketel one vodka, chamomile, lemon juice, Chartreuse. It is served up with an egg white foam on top. The cocktail was great but the bartender gave me a cocktail full of ice chips which was frustrating and really took away from the cocktail. I personally find it super unappealing and frustrating to get a cocktail with bits of ice floating when the drink  is meant to be served up. I also tried their Sicilian Sunset (Stoli vodka, Lillet Rose, passion fruit), I really enjoyed it. It was sweet but not too sweet; I found it to be pretty perfectly balanced. I would for sure order that again.   Now on to the food, we ordered the following items from their 4 course price fixe menu   Antipasti: :: Calabrian Cauliflower, Barolo Salami, Fennel and Arugula :: Bellweather Farms Ricotta, Prosciutto, Shaved Trumpet Mushrooms and Hazelnut  Primi Piatti: :: Ricotta Cavatelli, Pulled Chicken, Rosso Vin Cotto, Caper, Olive and Almond :: Squid Ink Linguine, Fennel, Tomato, Pork Sugo, Preserved Lemon and Bottarga  Secondi Piatti: :: Short Rib Alla Vaccinara, Barolo Agrodolce, Celery Puree, Charred Broccolini :: La Belle Farms Duck Breast, Horseradish Creamed Leek, Potato, Blackberry :: Maine Diver Scallop, Fregola, Cotechino, Preserved Lemon, Almonds  Dessert: :: Gianduja Grangelico Tiramisu, Roasted Banana, Espresso Gelato :: Meyer Lemon Semifreddo, Lambrousco Strawberry. Chiffon  For the first course, I really enjoyed both dishes. The Cauliflower was really the True standout, the Bellweather Farms Ricotta was delicious but I felt like it needed some form of texture. The prosiutto and the shaved trumpet mushrooms had really similar constancies and I just felt like they got lost a little bit in the ricotta, it needed some salt too... It would have really benefited from a sprinkling of some Maldon salt.   For the second course both the Ricotta Cavatelli and the Squid ink linguine were both perfectly cooked. The Ricotta Cavatelli was my favorite out of the two dishes, just a ton of great flavors going on in that dish. The Squid ink linguine again kinda lacked flavor, it really kind of fell flat. The couple of squid rings served with it were super overcooked as well.     For the Second Piatti, the Short Rib again was the standout - I felt like I was eating my friends dinner more than mine. They were perfectly braised, fall apart delicious, I wish they had served more of the celery root puree with it!   I initially got the La Belle Farms Duck Breast, but it was so overcooked that honestly it was almost inedible and (again) lacked any flavor. They basically cut up a couple of blackberries and put them on the dish and there wasn't really any sauce to try and add to the duck. Thankfully, a server (not ours) saw that I wasn't really eating the dish and asked if I was enjoying it. He was kind enough to bring me a replacement dish (the scallops). As soon as they brought the scallops out, they smelled fishy and when I tried one they tasted SUPER fishy. Fishy smell and taste with a shell fish is never a good thing. Lo and behold last night.... I got SICK.   The deserts were good, the Tiramisu was great but the Meyer Lemon Semifreddo didn't have any of that tart lemon flavor.   So some of the dishes were great, the portions were adequate - not huge but not tiny like some people have suggested. We did have bouts of great service, but unfortunately it wasn't from our server. Eric was MIA most of the evening, we hardly saw him and when you have a missing server it really is just a bummer. It takes away from the meal, but that's me... I'd eat mediocre food all day long if the service is amazing. I am bummed that I got sick from the scallops, kind of a bad way to end an evening.   Would I come back... I don't know. It's hard to look past the super spotty bordering on bad service and getting sick at the end of the evening. But I am intrigued because some of the dishes were great and I would be interested in trying more (maybe not order fish in the future? IDK).

V9iZpshM-OriBhLVrNg-1Q.text: The fat ox was an unexpected delight!  Great drinks, great room, great service and the food was excellent!  While service and food was A+, I would say that it was a more laid back vibe than super dress up fancy dining--and that was a nice break from having to be uptight to get great food.  I HIGHLY suggest the Fax Ox!

xJGIXi8JWTcbxETU3mLcyg.text: Amazing.. one of the best meals I have ever had. Everything was perfect from start to finish. Service was top notch, atmosphere was moody but not too dark, decor was beautiful, and oh the food was amazing did I mention that? Can't wait to go back, I will be craving everything until then.

ZkO-S3y1aOz0aut0tal34A.text: Great customer service! I have been back here a few times, and have always had a great experience. This last time, I was having cocktails at the bar and had left my card. The bartender ran my card all the way out to my car. FIVE STAR SERVICE!  The cocktails were great, especially the old fashion, and they have happy hour until 7. Ambiance is mid century modern and gets busy at night. Cool place, good food, five star customer service.   Thank you Mr. Bartender! We will be back!

nAoo_EjL1GMApogAkq0awA.text: Really nice atmosphere and great attentive service. We were in a group and our water and drink were never empty or even near empty. We had a family style  meal so we had a range of items from the pasta, sliced beef, chicken , salad , cheese plate etc and all was super tasty and not over seasoned or cooked. It all really tasted like it was naturally seasoned and felt like it was like a homemade meal .    The dessert trio was great but the highlight dessert was the carrot cake.  Will definitely return when I am back in Scottsdale .

-BikrE5K4PfXJ6YoqzJitQ.text: ***BEST DINNER IVE HAD IN AZ IN A LONG TIME Seriously, its about damn time...not kidding when I say EVERY course was really good. Truffle pasta...awesome! Scallops....sooo good. Steak??! Better than Mastro's in my opinion. Olive oil cake is a MUST. Great job guys!! You did it again!! (Its the same owners as ZINC, THE MISSION)

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Creamy polenta was good...not great. Needed salt
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Olive cake made RIGHT! I&#39;ve had some that taste like cheap olive oil. BUT NOT THIS ONE!!!
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak better than Mastro&#39;s...no more sloppy butter, mindless steak. This is legit

9ciPS1HP9tjTrRjaBdpAwg.text: Ambiance is lively and the space is open with the main dining area and then the smaller bar area.  Service is TOP notch SUPER welcoming and friendly.  I had the cauliflower and Salmon dish and both came out VERY quickly..maybe cuz I was at the bar and by myself?   Cauliflower has a nice spicy kick to it.. but not too spicy.  The crispy salmon was cooked to perfection and tasty ..the skin was nice and crispy..just as you would expect!   I plan on coming here again..this was my first visit and I was here on a business trip.   Thomas the bartender..awesome.

vP85PsRGOo8rq_ldWfZdsg.text: This review is primarily about the female server we had Friday evening.  She was amazing. Quick, friendly and thoughtful. I have never had anyone put a napkin on the floor so my purse would not get dirty (may not sound like much, but I thought it was very thoughtful right ladies?)  The portions seemed bigger than usual, thanks!!!  They change up their pasta dishes regularly, and they are always on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Server saw that I put my purse on the floor and she ran over with a napkin.  So thoughtful!! I thank you!

1DZ6IxyMJ4fTFXz_Ysn56w.text: This is by far the best restaurant in AZ! The service from the moment we walked in was great. We arrived early for our reservation and took a seat at a high top. Sarah was very attentive serving us in the bar area. When our table was ready we were well cared for by two friendly waiters that were very professional and knowledgeable. The table side prepared Caesar salad is worth coming for alone. The flavors of anchovies, fried capers, and lemon are so amazing that it'll be impossible not to order it every time I go there. Every single dish down to the bread and butter is obviously thought out to the smallest detail and beautifully plated. We followed the salad with the small order of mussels. It is a perfect size for two. They were perfectly cooked  and served in a tomato broth that will make you have to decide whether to dip your bread into it or enjoy the homemade Calabrian butter and ricotta cheese served with the bread. The Rosso Crest Di Gallo is handmade by Chef Steve Chops and incredibly delicious. Finally, we enjoyed the ribeye with brussels for the main course. It was perfectly cooked and served sliced into strips. We shared everything so I'm not sure if they did that for us or if that's how it is always served. I can't wait to try every item on their menu. The dinner was such a wonderful experience but our conversations with Brent who manages the Fat Ox and Chef Chops really made the evening extra special. The only negative is that the entire parking lot is valet. I personally can't stand being forced to use valet services.

SOtSXYQ7LdOwtu6km4i5bQ.text: Came here for dinner with my boyfriend for our anniversary. Since it was restaurant week, we opted in for the $44 per person menu. We got to choose an appetizer, main course and dessert each. We started ourselves with wine and the complimentary bread. The bread was olive oil, rosemary tasting with a side of spicy dip or olive oil cheese. We were both a fan of the bread and the cheese dip! Yum! We then started with our appetizers: scallops crudo & burrata di bufala which were both good but nothing exceptional. The scallops were really thin pieces and the burrata di bufala was also small bites but the taste was more unique and impressional. For the mains, we had: Ora king salmon & short rib vaccinara. The short rib was god and so was the salmon, but not impressionable either. However, they were still decent and tasted good, so it was solid. For desserts, we ended with: lemon panna cotta & gianduja franjelico tiramisu - the tiramisu didn't taste like the usual moist ones I e had, but I liked it a lot! The toasted banana bits and chocolates weren't overpowering to each other nor was it too sweet, a fan of it and would recommend to order. As for the lemon panna cotta, it was good too so not a bad choice to order either. We got pleasantly surprised with two glasses of complimentary champagne for our anniversary which was very sweet of the restaurant. Overall, solid and decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gianduja Franjelico Tiramisu

sEO0nGO_6cXvSSuqr-xCvw.text: Five-star service and cuisine to match! Brent was incredibly attentive to our group and the food was some of the best Italian in AZ. Had the simplest pasta on the menu as that is a True test. My fiance had the scallops and all was fabulous. A must try!

-RHKUA9YDXJXOfVosD3izA.text: I really wanted to like this place, I really did. I'm from Portland Oregon, and I am a server at a resort in paradise valley, so I work in the industry. I have lived in arizona for less than a year, hense I still have a oregon ID since that is the place I have resigned my 23 years. My first visit, my husband and I sat at the bar, I was told I could not be served due to my oregon ID, When asked if that was a fat ox rule I was told, it was a arizona state rule. Again I have lived here for over a year, I have bought liquor I've gone to a bunch of bars and never once has this been mentioned to me, again I do work in the service industry and this is never ever been something that is True. Fast forward till most three months later, my husband and I to the decided to try and give this place another chance. This time we chose to sit in the restaurant, it was supposed to be a very busy night so the only reservation we could make was at 5 o'clock, when we got there at 5 o'clock there was nobody in the restaurant we were the only table to be sat. My husband and I then ordered drinks, and we were not Asked for ID, no big deal, while our drinks were in transit to our table we were asked by our server if he could see our IDs because the bartender remembered us from three months prior, and that we might be offering fake IDs, I work in the service industry and this is extremely  offensive to us plus our drinks are already almost at the table so if they were fake you've already messed up because you've served us. Then he did serve us, but I have worked in MANY restaurants and this is by far the most UNPROFESSIONAL approach. Our server was very friendly, but our night was dampened by the fact that the same rude bartender was questioning my id! I had a now Arizona and passport with me to prove I am almost 24! The food was mediocre and after this experience, after giving a second chance I will never be back. Plus when guests at my resort ask I will absolutely say to avoid this place. During our 17 dollar table side Caesar the S.A did not once explain what he was doing or even interact with us. I will never be back, joke of a place for the area. There are plenty more WAY nicer places don't waste your time.

aD_vCZ2DKK8qNt2LcodHbw.text: 1000% recommended. This was an incredible meal, with amazing service. I will dream of the food I had.

UBAyuYEUW-1vx8AAZO04qw.text: I can't comment on the food sine we didn't eat there. We walked out when we saw the table they wanted to seat us at.  We arrived for our reservation and were shown to a "table" that could barely fit two people, placed in the middle of the room. We asked if a different table was a available (several were unoccupied), but were told they were for "reservations." Seems our reservation was not as important as others.  The food may be great, but I won't find out. Sitting in the middle of a room at a postage stamp sized table is not something I am interested in.

ipg5rZrnV7PG8KGUycMBEQ.text: First time to this restaurant. Nice venue and intimate feel even though its a big place. The menu looked so very good online but the food did not measure up for several reasons .  There were 6 of us who shared 3 orders of the Caesar salad.  It was well made and tasty but my portion was about 4 forkfuls. This is particularly upsetting and set the stage for what I feel is how they roll at this place. My friend had the "25 layer" lasagna which tasted good but was super small at about 4 inch by 3 inch as the name deceives. Two of my friends had the filet and liked their meals. The salmon was also very good.  I had the spaghetti with clams. It was delicious but only had one or 2  small non-tender clam pieces. I am Italian and although the flavors were outstanding I would be ashamed to serve this in my house. It could have been called " spaghetti with a clam".   The service was very slow and after  more 1.5 hrs we were ready for desert. My pana cotta tasted like it had refrigerator burn.  It looked pretty, and tasted good but fell short again because it definitely was not fresh.   I was looking forward to a great meal when I reserved. The review I read must have been done on one of their good nights. Personally I  think this restaurant is skimping on things. They charge a lot for their food and do not deliver.

H5O3aK8ckhGmQ3kK9Nq28A.text: I came in on Monday with a party of 12 and all of us girls loved the food and the waitress was extremely patient with us splitting checks and moving seats. Everyone loved their food and with the many people I was really surprised. I especially enjoyed the mussels and the Caesar salad and the petit filet. Also they let us stay after the restaurant closed to take pictures by the tree. They were very accommodating for us and I will definitely be coming back. I wish I could remember our waitresses name because she was really great.

rB04ddvM61OnnA4xz2ALAg.text: My favorite restaurant to dine at in Scottsdale! Every time I go the food and service is fabulous. I always look forward to my dinners at Fat Ox, and always take everyone from out of town as well as recommend it to those looking for a fabulous spot!  ALL of the pastas are to die for, the veal meatballs, the steak tar tar, charcuterie board, all desserts...EVERYTHING is just so good. I would dine here every night if I could!

7F65uM6LvwiZO344ISVNIA.text: Very nice place. More than expected. Service was exceptional!!! Restaurants wanting to up their service game need to take lessons from the Ox. The food was very good!

g__gz-opbiyYR3baUiDFkw.text: Great experience and the service was stellar. The wine selection and knowledge base the staff had to recommend a perfect choice was impressive. They knew how to pair the wine with your entree and what would bring the notes forward for the best experience. I have a terrible pallet when it comes to wine tasting. LoL Give a dry Cab and that's about the extent of my pallet. LoL   The food was well prepared and the sauces were fresh with a from scratch taste. The pasta was delicious, which we had no complaints. You couldn't possibly go wrong. I had the sword fish (amazing) and the classic 25 layer lasagna to try (I planned on taking the rest for a lunch the next day lol) and it was absolutely the best lasagna I've had in a good while. The sauce was consistent and not cheese overwhelming as some lasagna you may find elsewhere.   As for pricing, it's what you would expect and consistent with the quality and atmosphere. If your expecting a budget friendlier fare, you may wanna stick with Oreganos possibly. This is par for the service and overall experience.   Great for a happy hour and the patio is wonderful. Thanks for a great experience Fat Ox!

I2PyfkjUkWbjmbUdQlgYXA.text: This place exceeded expectations on practically every level imaginable. There were 3 couples in our party for a birthday celebration. I asked our server James if the restaurant ever offered a Chef's tasting menu as we went through the menu with him (thinking it may be a future dining option). James was excited to offer us a family style dining experience which allowed us to taste quite a few different menu items. My personal favorites were the mussels, beef tartare, Garganelli pasta, roasted cauliflower, short ribs, grilled pork and Affogato.  James and his partner (apologies for not recalling his name) were fantastic in every aspect of their craft and are strongly recommended. We really put our menu in he hands of James and the kitchen and we were all blown away with the phenomenal meal, start to finish! I would be remiss if I did not mention that the meal was taken to the next level by the wine pairings selected by Mark, the restaurant's Somm. Mark knocked it out of the park with his awesome (and sensible) selections. This is the sort of effort that separates the good places from the great ones.  Thanks to everyone at Fat Ox for making our evening fantastic!

zrw-dSpEGOGNNGI1_1PP3Q.text: We've tried this restaurant a couple of times now. I wanted to give it a try again before I wrote a review.  It was surprisingly easy and straight forward to get reservations for a Saturday evening and we were seated as soon as we got there. There were 2-3 servers that approached our table and introduced themselves and said they'd be taking care of us but that changed pretty quickly. Our "primary" server Aaron knew the menu well and helped make selections but came across as a little pushy.. never felt that with a server so that takes away 1 star from my review.  Everything else was totally on point - decor, ambience, food, our secondary servers who did take over eventually.  House bread, butter and ricotta is phenomenal.  Table side Caesar salad 5/5 - must try!  While the scallops were a little too buttery and greasy,  the green tortellini blew my mind!   All dishes have a relatively smaller serving size.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Table side Caesar Tableside Caesar Salad (serves two)

Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tiramisu and affogato

BDTxnU_XgVvAw4e0Lh7DTA.text: This was hands down one of the most life changing experiences of my life! A group of 5 of us went here to celebrate a few birthdays and an engagement. I was blown away by the service provided to us. The food was out of this world! I would love to eat here as many times as possible in my lifetime!

Kf1DRD7aVUspDUn_oThoyw.text: This place was incredible. The pasta was melt in your mouth delicious. Everything we ordered was delicious. I can't wait to go back.

co1EqzqTR2ixz8LDTySl8A.text: In a word, Wow! Every bite was delicious! We started with the Prosciutto Ricotta. Incredibly creamy ricotta and simply prepared trumpet mushroom with a just right prosciutto that pulled it all together! I also had Green Tortellini, that was perfect! The house made pasta was so tender and perfectly cooked! A gem.   Now the ugly; the service was spotty and the restaurant was obnoxiously loud so if you're looking for an intimate, cared-for dinner, not the place. But! If all you care about is delicious, perfect food, this is an Italian dream!

YxG47CPq_tKJfx6eWGSihw.text: Only three stars for a very simple reason that hopefully the restaurant can fix. Five stars for the food. My mom and husband said it was the best food they ever had. Mine and my daughters was delicious too. Plainly stated, the service was bad. It took 15!minutes just to get water. We asked for an additional water later on and the waiter opening our wine said "this isn't my table. I am just doing him a favor." Our waiter was fine, perhaps a bit smug, but mostly just an infrequent visitor. We would have ordered dessert but we waited so long for the dessert menus that we just decided to pay the bill. This place could become a frequent rotation but not with service like this.  Standout dishes include the 25 layer lasagna and the short rib. Also the lentil side dish was delish. Salmon was good as was the gargonelli but it was really too salty and I don't think I have never said that about a dish. I love salt. The homemade pasta was amazing though. The grapefruit basil martini was a yummy start to the meal. The table side Caesar was a super cool concepts but didn't taste that good. The meat and cheese platter was amazing.

c2ZYYsiGvbAl9MzuCF_cFA.text: My friends and I came to check out Fat Ox during the most recent Arizona Restaurant Week, and had a fantastic experience. I arrived a few minutes before our 7:30 reservation and were seated immediately. Their wine list is extensive, and their tables are set with the biggest wine goblets I've ever seen. They have a small but interesting cocktail (or "oxtail") menu, and my Bulleits over Bordeaux was strong and delicious. The dishes here are small, but well plated and definitely well done. I had the burrata di bufala, short rib vaccinara, and gianduja frangelico tiramisu. Short ribs are my go to order at most restaurants, and the ones here did not disappoint. The dish here came with three medallion sized pieces, which were perfectly fork tender and came with the most delicious glaze. I also stole a couple bites of my friend's Gigli dish, and the pasta was absolutely amazing. I'm not sure if the portions were smaller due to restaurant week, and I personally left pretty full, but a bigger eater might be left wanting. The desserts here were standard, good but not mind blowing. My tiramisu was creamy and fluffy without being too sweet, though it came on a solid chocolate base that made it a little challenging to eat. I did appreciate that they had espresso options as well as French pressed coffee. Service overall was very attentive, and the employees all looked genuinely happy to be at work, which is a huge plus.   Note: the parking lot by Fat Ox is pretty small and fills up quickly, but there's usually ample space over by Fogo de Chao.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gianduja Franjelico Tiramisu
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Short ribs
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cocktail menu as of May 2018

CG1zBqGFXQTWVT_DCm8IXw.text: Spectacular. One of the best meals I've ever had. Great service. Great food. Great cocktails. Great atmosphere. Nothing not to love. And I was there with two little kids. Still a great experience.  I cannot recommend this place enough. Yes, it's expensive. But you can taste the quality in the food. You can see the quality in the service. Do yourself a favor: make a reservation.    ****  Returned to Fax Ox recently, this time with just my wife and I. Could not have been better. We didn't have a reservation but called ahead. They reserved space for us at the communal table. The hostess recalled our name as soon as we arrived and seated us immediately. The server was friendly and attentive. The meal was wonderful. We had gigli pasta and short rib. This may be my new favorite place. We will go back. Often.

XSFUSGI9BOBGZYApYTs3lw.text: Outstanding food, a big variety of outstanding cocktails, great atmosphere and wonderful service.....what more can you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

whaBi7WOC6VaYGEe8eGnMw.text: Went here with a party of five and had the cheeseboard appetizer, pappardelle pasta with pork, beef short ribs and pistachio gelato. The cheeseboard was great- had some unique mild cheeses and fresh prosciutto. The pappardelle pasta had an amazing flavor and the pork was very tender. The beef short ribs had a demi glace sauce over them that I did not like and they were very charred. I would definitely not order them again. The pistachio gelato was smooth and had a hint of rose flavor to it that was delicious. The ambiance was very modern and the music was very loud.

gcyKIHmkgwmecHjNMp0tpw.text: We went for the first time to this restaurant during  Arizona Restaurant week-Spring 2018.(special menu-3 courses for $44/person) They also serve regular menu as well during this special event. We both started off  with the pasta. One of us had the Gigli and the other the Tagliatelle. The Gigli is on the regular menu, but the Tagliatelle is not.They were both excellent in portion,taste, & presentation. The next course we had Ora King Salmon-not on the regular menu, but there is a Salmon with crispy skin. The other Secondi Piatti was the Short Rib Vaccinara which is on the regular menu. Says it has raisins in this dish, but I did not see or taste them and I am not a fan of raisins.  Both second courses were excellent.  Dolce course we had Gianduja Franjelico Tiramisu which looked like 1/2 the portion from the photos I've seen from the regular menu and it also did not include the espresso gelato-which all was ok. The portion served was perfect and it was very good,especially the chocolate on the plate. The other dessert we had was the Bronte Pistachio gelato-2 scoops which is also on the regular menu.  Just a mention the first course on the "special menu" had a Burrata di Bufala which was different ingredients from the regular menu and the veal meatballs were also on the regular menu.  Our server Shaun was excellent and we also had another waiter come around and help out, very attentive service from the moment we sat down to the end. We were offered different types of water, we opted for the local Scottsdale water.  Another note we had a Bloody Mary and a Barrel aged(Buffalo Trace) Manhattan from the cocktail list. My DH finished the Bloody Mary the quickest I have seen him, so it must have been good. He usually never finishes a cocktail before I do or rarely finishes his alcohol.  The meats are slow roasted and the pastas made in house. We thought all the portions were a good size and did not leave hungry. Just a note we did not eat our "normal" full lunch portion either. We enjoyed our visit to Fat Ox.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary &amp; Manhattan cocktails
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Front of the restaurant
