2rjm5zjLCanR46ZrsV3dnQ.text: My husband and I were so excited to try this place. Our waiter was so nice and he knew what he was doing. Everything was going well until we got our appetizers, which were great. And then we waited almost an hour to get our entrees. The waiter apologized and he said the kitchen sucks I'm sorry. Then the manager came and apologized to our table and then we got a complementary  drink. When we got our dessert my amaretto gelato came with a wrap paper on it.. it was disgusting to feel the paper in my mouth. I was really disappointed about that. I spoke with the manager on duty and he didn't say a word. He took the plate to the kitchen. I think this is a high-end restaurant and you don't expect things like this to happen in places like this. I work in a guest service environment and I'm definitely not recommending this place to my guests.

t4rJ7tNVTM6cypa7EXFKsg.text: Absolutely loved our dining experience here, the service was amazing and everyone was so friendly and sweet. I am 36 weeks pregnant and they made me feel very special. The ricotta appetizer dish with prosciutto is incredible!! I had their gluten free lamb pasta and my husband had scallops and we shared the cauliflower side. We will for sure be back.  The restaurant is clean and inviting too. 5 stars!

F1ayJgIadqugcXa4lkNA6w.text: Fabulous evening on the patio with my Fiancee. Excellent service from starting with a warm greeting in the parking lot to the beautiful smiles at the front desk. Our server was prompt, sweet and attentive. Highly recommend the Barrel aged Manhattan and the Caesar Salad. I had the Scottish Salmon - excellent bites of risotto with the salmon. My love had the trumpet mushrooms (only $9, really?) and the butternut squash pasta (hand rolled) . Topped it off with tiramisu and tawny port.  Fat Ox is an excellent addition to the Scottsdale restaurant scene. We will be regulars.

npdnri3mLIFwnGl4kwlvkg.text: Food is so flavorful and outside of this world. We had a party of 25 and the servers were so hands on and fast. The best items are the linguini and the 8 oz creek stone fillet with extra mushroom sauce. This restaurant and the mission are tied to be my favorite restaurants.

wNzxDiR3wnsEP91X2DGF3g.text: My boyfriend and I came here Saturday for date night, first time dining at Fat Ox. I must say I was pleasantly surprised! The atmosphere is great, although the music was a tad loud but that's typically of Scottsdale restaurants. The service is exceptional, our waitress was entirely lovely, very prompt and genuinely seemed to enjoy her job. The pasta is above average and the wine list is pretty extensive. It is definitely not a cheap night out, so I'd say its the perfect spot for a special occasion or nice date. We will definitely be returning!!!

7vUc7hmxzg4Bd9mFxFOZ_g.text: Walking in - beautiful decor, very tasteful entry sequence, warm wood furniture and a buzzing atmosphere. HOWEVER, the wall adjacent to hostess stand is adorned with framed photos of disembodied female parts. Legs, butts, some breasts - not a single face in sight. What is this doing in such a classy and refined interior?? Wait...it gets worse! The men's restroom is filled - FILLED - with framed soft core porn. No artist name, no model name, but stock photos of nude and anonymous women. The women's restroom - similar but different. Boudoir style photos in every stall. If there's GOING to be sexy pics - how come women don't get to see boobs as well????? This is pre-WWI attitude about women on display in a way that does NOT vibe with the rest of the restaurant. It's as if the architect, interior designer, executive chef, bar and wait staff are all on one page - a page that is classy, well executed, and delicious - and the owner walked around and hung up some tactless pics to demonstrate HIS views about a women's role in the world.

Wibdt5Jxz5NDymdmPWa8XQ.text: James made my boyfriend and I's anniversary very special. The food was amazing, but the service was even better. Couldn't have asked for a better night and server.

F9biIO5h_2QIFTAEDZEQVg.text: Wow! This place was wonderful. My husband found the Fat Ox, which was near our resort, on yelp and made a reservation on Open Table and mentioned we were celebrating our Anniversary. We went on a Monday evening, so it was not super busy. I love italian food, especially anywhere that serves homemade pasta. The entire restaurant space was beautiful, very classy. We were seated on the lovely patio. The view isn't much, but it's far enough off the street that you can't hear any of the traffic noise. The server mentioned our anniversary and brought us some complimentary Prosecco, which was very thoughtful. I wish I could remember our server's name, because she was absolutely wonderful. She steered us in the right direction for each course selection. We started with the mozzarella burratta, which was simple but fresh and delicious. We then moved on to the pasta course, where we couldn't decide, so again she helped us choose the Garganelli and Lamb rigatoni. They were perfectly portioned and absolutely delicious. We could have probably just kept eating pasta, but we also ordered the scallops to share. This was a good decision because we were quite full by this point. The scallops were perfectly cooked with great flavor. Our server offered a complimentary dessert, but we ordered more drinks instead as we were much too full for dessert. I ordered an espresso martini, which definitely hit the spot. Overall, this was a wonderful meal and we will certainly be back the next time we are in Scottsdale.

8HOTVME4AntySbfZoBJgYw.text: Yummmmm came here on a Monday and had a great dinner.. had a duo wait staff!  Great Bib salad and pasta dishes.. will be back home when back here...

w97P5zC4uLIsY0UaipJDkQ.text: My fiance and I came here for our engagement anniversary and everything was wonderful. We made a reservation for a Wednesday night and spent about two hours enjoying nearly everything on the menu. The ricotta appetizer, the veal meatballs, the duck sausage pasta, the crab ravioli, the scallops, the salmon, the panna cotta, and the lemon tart - everything was fabulous and the grapefruit basil martini was one of the best drinks I've ever had (strong but sour and delicious.) If my review was based on only my first visit, I'd be giving 5 stars, but averaging out my first and second experience, I am hesitant to give even three stars. My fiance and I came back for happy hour today and felt mostly ignored by the bartender. With three people behind the bar, it's hard to understand why we would not be tended to at a barely half full bar. To start off with, the bartender gave me the wrong wine. I asked for a Sauvignon Blanc and was delivered a Chardonnay. When I asked him if it was a Sauvignon Blanc or a Chardonnay he flat out told me it was a Chardonnay because he couldn't remember which I had ordered and basically just guessed. We ordered the beef tartare, the duck sausage pasta (again), the lamb rigatoni and the veal meatballs. Again, all the food was amazing, but the service was severely lacking. We arrived about an hour before happy hour ended, and wanted to get our food in before then but were ignored for so much of our visit it became irritating. Even when our bartender passed us, it was only to deliver a drink to another guest and he barely even made eye contact. My fiance ordered a gin and juice to start and wanted a second one, but had to flag our bartender down in order to get it in for happy hour, and I couldn't even get his attention to order the same drink a few minutes later, so I ordered from a different bartender.  Not once were we asked if we needed anything else or if we wanted refills as our drinks were getting low towards the end of happy hour. We felt very unimportant. It was clear that the regulars were getting better service as our bartender spent much more time with a clear regular who ordered one beer, which was comped, than he did with us as we racked up a decent bill. The final problem was with my grapefruit basil martini. The only way I can describe it is warm vodka with a basil leaf placed on top. I instantly knew it was wrong as it was not the delicious drink I had enjoyed the first time we visited. This drink was made by a different bartender, who I have assume was new based on what she served me. Again, it took quite a long time to get our bartenders attention (he was talking to another staff member at the other end of the bar, with his back turned to us and all the other patrons) so we could tell him about the problem. When he finally came over I showed him the drink and even he said it looked completely wrong, and he remade it. This was the second problem with one of my drinks and I never spoke to a manager even for an apology. The second martini was much better, and I definitely enjoyed it, but the whole experience was lame. Our bartender dropped off our check before we asked for it as well, before I had ordered my last drink. He quickly put the drink in and gave us a new check, not asking if we wanted anything else. Our bill was already over $100 at this point, I don't understand why he didn't try to sell dessert, or at least wait for me to enjoy my last drink to see if my fiance or I wanted another. We wanted dessert, but being pushed out that way turned us off from staying any longer. Overall our second experience was not impressive and I am extremely happy it was not our first time because I'm not sure the food could have made up for the service if we had not been there before. Fat Ox as we know it has wonderful food, reasonable prices, strong and delicious drinks and great service, but this time was an overall failure. We will try it again, but will be hoping for much more attentive service.

-nV0cpBZ81O34EnVMB-Lmw.text: So we didn't know what we were walking into when we went to dinner here. When looking at the menu we thought it to be a bit expensive until we had the food. This food was top notch. Everything we had was delicious.  We aren't big on seafood so I just wished there were a few more dishes to chose from that did not have seafood. But other than that I would highly recommend if you are looking for a nice dinner.

DdaFGjCi_FoRHeBgdPWIxg.text: Incredible food, awkward service. We started with a salad, then each got a pasta dish, and finished with the sea scallops. Everything about the food was spot on; we loved the flavors and how everything was cooked. No complaints at all about the food! The service on the other hard was difficult to understand. Our waiter seemed disengaged and did not really seem to understand what we wanted from him as a server. He continued to talk about the dishes that we did not have questions about and would interrupt at very odd times. I wish I could give this place 3.5 stars because the food was delicious, but the service needs some work. If I could recommend anything, I would say: wait until the guests ask questions before providing suggestions and always ask for drink orders before giving the overview of the food. Overall, it was a good experience, but not great.

AEnJOjou5nvnuU0MzhwVTA.text: Excellent experience! We came to fat ox to try out the food during restaurant week. We were not disappointed, it was insanely good food and service. Ayla (bartender) was our server and she could not have been any better. Knowledgeable, responsive and had excellent recommendations. We had several different options the- burrata with the pork belly wow outstanding- not super fatty just super meaty. Had a few of the hh pastas - tortellini was best bite of the night in my opinion. My husband had the brick chicken it was delicious!!!! Moist with lots of cool things that you could add - aioli, hot sauce etc. We also had the gigli which my mom loved, and the skirt steak. We were all highly impressed with the restaurant and couldn't say enough about our food and service. I would come back just for Ayla..... but now we know the food is amazing also!!! Thanks for impressing some tough diners!

PuDId_MFg8s21GwA3dFa5Q.text: This restaurant is absolutely outstanding!!!  From the food, to the presentation, to the service, the wine list and the staff.... fantastic!!!  I have several food allergies, and they were so accommodating.  My meal was one of the best I have had to date since we moved to Scottsdale 2.5 years ago, and we eat out constantly!  We will be back!!!!

lOqvugsFmywC-LIErhQvpA.text: I dined here last night for the first time. Came in with no expectations & was extremely surprised & pleased with the whole experience. Right away, the manager/host Darvay (probably butchered the name, sorry!) greeted my boyfriend and I at the door by name, ready to take us to our table. We were seated at a pleasant corner table in the back. Our server Canton was amazing. He knew the menu inside & out, as well as drinks & wine. We started off with two tequila/mezcal cocktails & then asked him about switching to a bottle of wine. He recommended a very nice 2005 red blend called Arcanum. We ordered the burrata & the prosciutto to start, then had the ricotta pasta with rabbit tenderloin which was incredible. We then had the 18oz ribeye, the half Jidori chicken with polenta(amazing), & the short rib alla vaccinara(something like that). We ended the evening with two shots of Avion tequila & dessert! We had the tiramisu which had a chocolate mousse like chocolate base, on the side was an espresso ice cream & these chocolate crunchy balls on the side. We also tried the pistachio Gelato which was so good and I'm not very into pistachio ice cream. Every dish was super unique & delicious. My two favorites were the pasta & the short rib. The restaurant itself is beautiful & I will be back. Not your typical italian restaurant...in my opinion it is much much better. Go try it out & request Canton!! He will make your experience amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Arcanum 2005 Toscana Red Blend
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ricotta filled pasta with rabbit tenderloin. My fave.
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cauliflower side, half jidori chicken, short rib entree, 18oz ribeye, &amp; two sides of polenta. Amazing.

2A7qyvFWOBElry2Fdf9YqQ.text: Fat Ox has a clean, trendy interior with great light exposure from large windows on north side of restaurant. Menu items are intended to be shared among the table but not required. The menu also has multiple courses and if you order according to how it's designed, will take you through multiple courses. Portion sizes vary greatly but a single dinner entree is large enough to get full. Service was pretty good. Our waitress walked us through the experience and did a great job explaining the menu. Food itself was good as well, but it is a little pricey, and I didn't feel that it was distinct enough to pay what we did. They do have a large cocktail and wine menu as well.

auTURyOzNWS1bPHMZ8xmeA.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. We tried 2 appetizers, 2 pastas, 2 main courses and 2 desserts and we probably really only liked 3 of the 8 dishes we paid for. That's not a great ratio for a $200+ bill. (For the record the dishes we liked were the Caesar salad, tiramisu, and olive oil cake. Not really worth that high of a price to only like an appetizer and 2 desserts. Oh and the olive oil cake is TINY FYI) We also ordered a few things that were either the most popular, or the waitresses favorites...  We were seated immediately and we only called ahead by 45 minutes. We liked our waitress and the staff seemed helpful. It was busy and our waitress disappeared for awhile, but overall was very helpful and attentive. Be mindful that they charge for water.   Personally I'd probably give them another shot bc I am pregnant and didn't get to try different varieties of raw food, but I'm pretty sure my husband wouldn't go back. He is a great cook himself and really the problems weren't that the dishes were awful, it's just that each one lacked something to make it truly flavorful. They looked beautiful and tasted "ok." I could easily list out each meal we had and why it wasn't that great, (even small things like salt...) but I'll spare you. But I think trying 8 dishes is definitely giving a restaurant a fair shot before leaving a review.  For us personally, we should have spent $200+ on groceries and had a nice meal at home. (For the record... we aren't cheap.., But if a meal cost $45 then it should taste that way. What I tasted, honestly, shouldn't have been more than $20 a plate) But if you've got money to burn, aren't really a "foodie" and just want to try different restaurants in the area, then go for it!  After reading other reviews I see that this is the same chef as The Mission, which I enjoy. We should have just gone there;)

6yygBAzwGain8QTgX1odhQ.text: WOW, $$$$ for what you get. Not that good. Everyone was so disappointed in their meal. Apps good and a great sommelier, but that's it. Uneven service and grossly overpriced for what you get. Won't be back.

pPodNwZbZEini-fZBiDANQ.text: Everything was beautiful and delicious. We had the lamb verde, swordfish and scallops to name a few. The atmosphere is nice with patio options. The guys in our group enjoyed the mens bathroom art.

8Y2yRHWPM6rGvbWiwKefFw.text: Pretty sad experience here that's for sure. First our waiter was super sick. He voice was so horse he literally had to talk directly in your face to hear him. And I didn't enjoy having his sick breath blown in my face that's for sure. The food tasted amazing but the portions were extremely small. I don't mind paying a lot of good food but at least give me a portion I can get decently full on. I brought my girlfriend at the time, she ordered some pasta dish. She's pretty small and doesn't eat that much, but she was still really hungry after she ate so I told her to order another one. After they brought us our check the waiter hovered around waiting for me to put the card in the thing, felt rushed.

1a9Dp9a-B2_iZGSLCReB1w.text: The ambiance was great but the service was quite the opposite. My waitress did not give us the full dining experience neglecting to serve us the table side Caesar. Failed to refill waters and bring over napkins and utensils. While my entire pasta was very good, I expected more of the service and dining experience. Would not return

PSt-Hgul42YxNR2bQl1ADw.text: One word- "overrated". I wanted to like them so badly as my fiance has wanted to try this place for so long! Service was horrible, food mediocre at best, save your money and go elsewhere! Snotty Scottsdale at it's worst!

hn4ozD-9uaJF2Q22VddJhw.text: This is definitely a favorite for my husband and I! Perfect for any date night, girls night out, or celebration. From service to food i would give this restaurant a 5+ stars. Our second time there the manager even said to us "welcome back great to see you guys again!" I mean that sure does go a long way in terms of customer service! Our servers both times have been phenomenal and never made us felt rushed or pushed throughout dinner!   If you are looking for a cool hip vibe away from the suburb life, this is definitely a must go to!   Be sure to try the Gigli pasta! So Delicious!!!!!!!

uL6NCu712ItV9y9NqfB2gw.text: Food is outstanding. Waitstaff first rate. Decor beautiful.  Arrived on time for our reservation, but waited nearly 1 hour past our reservation time to be seated. Finally seated at table next to the bar, where noise level made conversation impossible. Beyond embarrassed to take out of town guests out for a nice dinner.   My previous experiences at Fat Ox were wonderful. This was far from it.

gaTovFJuIkFZW9L_lq6VBQ.text: Everything from start to finish was phenomenal. One of the most beautiful restaurants in AZ and hands down the BEST Italian food in AZ

SXN9bGP_U4aKW_pGOv6wzA.text: High expectations.   Handsome physical plant.  Truffled pasta was flavorful, but truffle wasn't discernible.   Staff was warm, if not occasionally disingenuous. For example, without advance guidance, we learned that kohlrabi was essentially cannelloni beans with minimal greens and $110 steak meant to serve three was gristly and modest in size. Server assured us she'd alert kitchen, yet we received no feedback.   Upon completion of ordering meal courses, staff presence was sparse.   Tiramisu was to have been accompanied by coffee gelato that seemed more like a crystalline iced coffee.  A part of me craves one more try, but I'm not sure what might merit the effort.

bU-dr7epP9cl-eDT1-NRYw.text: Wanted to like this place...have tried it a few times now and I just can't go back for dinner. Maybe drinks.  The portions are tiny and I haven't found anything that's really memorable / "craveable". The caesar might be one of the best things and it's nothing special (plus it's lettuce).  The burrata is literally 2 teaspoons of cheese floating in a bowl, really strange presentation and absolutely ridiculous portion. The casoncelli pasta is actually really good but it is 6-7 pieces of pasta lined up on a plate.  Entrees were really expensive for what you get and none of the meat or the salmon that I've tasted has been memorable. Disappointing.

Qth9zgjxN9ZxhzwoqR1kPw.text: Chef Matt Carter and front-man Brian Raab have knocked it out of the park...again. These are the guys who brought us The Mission (including the new location in Kierland), The House Brasserie, and had a hand in Zinc Bistro as well.  These guys are at the absolute top of their culinary and hospitality games, and it shows the second you walk in any one of their doors, where you will be greeted by professional, friendly, and efficient hosts/hostesses, and then served well-crafted cuisine by True professionals who are knowledgeable and passionate about the food and drink they are serving, prepared and plated by a kitchen brigade that puts out consistently delicious and impeccably presented fare.  Fat Ox is a successful attempt by this team to exceed their already exceptional standards, and it is fine dining at its best: upscale without feeling overwrought; mesmerizing without being ostentatious; and satisfying to every sense and every sense of the word.  The cuisine is inspired by Italian classics, with a modern twist, and includes vegetarian, pasta, beef, poultry, and seafood entrees, along with a substantial offering of charcuterie, cheese, salads, and other lighter plates perfect for small meals and/or sharing as part of a more extensive dining experience. A nice dessert selection is also available, along with coffees and after-dinner liquers. There are also a number of interesting and tasty hand-pressed cocktails to choose from, including some interesting combinations that really work well.  The extensive wine list is fabulous, presented by an experienced sommelier who can guide everyone from the occasional wine-sipping novice to the more experienced wine enthusiast, with equal aplomb (in our case, it was "Stephen", who set the table up with a wine flight to go with each course, including a palate-awakening rose in the salad and cheese course, a couple of reds of varying fullness and profile with the pasta plate and entree, and a sweet lambrusco to finish it off).  Highly-recommended for anyone who loves creative food well-prepared, in a setting with an energetic vibe, served by professional and efficient staff.

6XGc23KzIf46vkGa-AVsNA.text: Outstanding destination for modern dining. We went on opening night, and you would think they had been open for years. Busy to capacity, staff was on point in every regard, knowledgeable, their in house sommelier came over to greet us, as well as management. We left the order entirely up to the waiter, and boy did he wow us. I couldn't name the foods we tried because there were so many, but it's safe to say the most memorable were definitely the Steamed Mussels, the Agnolotti and Garganelli. We finished off with a couple of their 28oz Dry Aged Prime Porterhouse, which was undoubtedly the best I've ever had. Wow. And then, just when we thought we were full up, they bring out this extraordinary Bronte Pistachio Gelato that was to die for. I could have indeed died that night and been utterly satisfied. We will be back, matter of fact, maybe even tonight! Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 28oz Dry Aged Prime Porterhouse. Best in town!

12fRYK8JjsUWqKMS_YJnrA.text: Fat Ox remains at the top of my list for fantastic restaurants. The pastas are freshly prepared and arguably as good, if not better that the best I have experienced in Italy. The balance of the menu is fantastic as well. Salads served table side. Deserts and entrees never disappoint. Service is exceptional.  They are attentive, but not bothersome. The environment is lively, but not overly loud. A great place to introduce anyone who has never been to Fat Ox. I have out of town guests frequently that request another visit to Fat Ox. I will be visiting again soon. Thanks Fat Ox for the exceptional experiences.

b06TPPVbiY1iSWkVvHFEdg.text: HECK YES !!!  Our first trial and it was a home run.  We have a list of restaurants we want to try now that the snowbirds have left and Fat Ox was a great start to our summer !  But we warned, this is not your Mom's typical Italian home cooking.  Don't go here if your looking for old fashion spaghetti !  This is Modern Italian Cuisine and is it good!  Very complex flavors and textures.  Interesting restaurant design but I would imagine the volume would get pretty cranked up when the place is packed.  Looked like an up scale crowd even during the non-snowbird season.  Service was great, Thanks Canton, and all the staff was very friendly - everyone wished us a good night as we left as if they all served us.    Great food, nice staff - what else could you want ?

j1_ojO_fx8Xe_lpR700eXg.text: Food, ridiculous!!!   This is my style of dining, European. Cocktail list is diverse, wine list expansive.   The pasta was especially tasty. (Pro-tip; it's not an entree.)  The manager, (Darvey?) stopped by with genuine interest in our experience.   BONUS: female chefs!

xZHWYF5BfEP2X91TAyMpGA.text: I did not enjoy this restaurant at all.  The waitress was great but the food was not worth the cost of the dinner.  Compared to other restaurants in town this place is not worth it going too.  The atmosphere is okay but nothing special.  I would skip going here for sure.

RgLV8NphzAmvGSwV7ylFKA.text: After last evening, I think that they should be called Fan & SLOW Ox.  Our party of six arrived at 6:00 p.m. and the restaurant was less than half full.  We were seated promptly and the waiter did the usual walk-through on appetizers, specials & featured items.  He took drink orders and (except for one person), all the drinks came right out.  Then we had our apps and placed our entree orders.  After more than an hour - with no check backs, explanations or comments from our waiter - I finally snagged the manager and asked where our food was.  It took them about 2 minutes to bring out all the entrees then, which tells me that they were prepped and sitting under a light in the kitchen.  The next aggravation was that we had to ask multiple times to get all the sides that we had ordered.  After all of our questions, we were comped on dessert, which was appreciated.  In all the 3+ hour experience was not worth the inflated prices.  We will not return there.

G8yQeqLPx7EoqKbONpDyoQ.text: I first visited Fat Ox for a work dinner recently and had the 25 Layer Lasagna which was fantastic and had to put this on my list of must-go restaurants. Brought a colleague in for dinner tonight and enjoyed a Chef's Board and the Green Tortellini. The Chef's Board was delicious, however, I think I'll stick with the 25 Layer Lasagna for future visits. Our waitress, Amanda, was absolutely spectacular. The service was top-notch, our drinks were never empty, and our food was prompt to our table. Definitely looking forward to returning again soon!

Rh7hYBJOV46HM9i-WGB-hw.text: The food is pretty overrated. The server never asked us what type of water we wanted, and they kept refilling our glasses, so we were all pretty shocked when we had to pay $50 for water?!?' WTH, if you are charging for the water, or making someone only drink the bottled not tap at least tell them so they know. Nothing memorable about the food. They tried too hard to make it unique, so it just ended up tasting shitty and weird.

5iaUXSQAHdsYRTrGE2EXfQ.text: First time trying this restaurant and it was a delightful surprise. Every moment was enjoyable and we will definitely be going back. Our server Canton was outstanding, can't say enough about him. He was charming, attentive & knowledgeable. He recommended several dishes and every single one was delicious. I would recommend the table-side Cesar as a must as well as the crab ravioli & homemade pasta with truffle & speck. Lots of unique & delicious flavor combinations. Must try the side of roasted cauliflower. We finished the meal with a decadent Tiramisu accompanied by expresso gelato. After all that our server Canton made recommendations for our next visit and to our surprise brought out a serving of homemade pistachio gelato for us to try. The entire experience won us over & we will no doubt become regular customers.

ZC-mVt2g7D6Lpco4_4n13A.text: We dined last night with our daughters and their husbands. This birthday celebration was fantastic. Staff was excellent.  We were treated to one of the best dinners in a long time. The caeser salad was done to perfection. Some of us have limitations GF , etc. All our salads were designed for our needs. The rest of the food was just as wonderful. Too many dishes to mention . I will definitely return and recommend to all my friends and family.   One suggestion.Since we eat fish as our main protein we would like more choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6jwOiABLhesAMGhVvwIU6A.text: Some friends and I went to Fat Ox last night and had one of the best dining experiences ever.  First, the service was spectacular-  thank you AJ and your team.  Thoughtful, helpful, yet not overbearing.  AJ's recommendations were also spot on - including how much food to order.  Second, the atmosphere was gorgeous, sophisticated yet comfortable.  We could hear each other! Finally, the food was freaking delicious. We had the table side prepared Caesar (no raw eggs), which I loved because they used butter lettuces and didn't overdo the dressing.  We also tried the avocado and buffaletta with grilled avocado - I really liked the avocado and added it to my Caesar.  The others loved the cheese (never my favorite anywhere).  Then we tried two pastas - my favorite was the tortellini.  OMG the pasta was cooked perfectly and the inside was creamy and delicious.  I had the meatballs for my final dish (the others had scallops).  Those meatballs (3) nestled in the creamiest, most amazing polenta I have ever tasted we're ... I am running out of superlatives! ... magnificent.  We tried the tiramisu, lemon tart and chocolate tart.  All were very good - consensus being lemon tart was the best.  Very fresh, perfectly balanced sweet and tart.  I cannot wait to go back.  One of the girls is going back Sunday!

lni2BfDVH84kjYtV43jrUQ.text: $7 for water and the mussels were terrible, not a good first visit. Too many great choices nearby to stop here IMO.

ruJT06U9CqgiM-FMB_ICMA.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Phoenix, hands down. Not only was the ambiance amazing, but the food was five star. I recommend the meatballs, garganelli and the pork was out of this world (although slightly fatty on some bites). The drinks were great too! Definitely coming back!

Z51jCg9bJbL0Y2kEzajj_w.text: Overall, great experience! Nice, modern atmosphere. The bar tender and staff were on point. They provided solid recommendations. Their pastas are made fresh at the restaurant. Great menu selection; not your typical standard dishes.  Although I did pass, the dessert looked very good.  Highly recommend.

s3uYwSglMXza4KKEMjrjJQ.text: This place is loud. Could not hear the people at my table. It's also dark, lighting wise. It's a very serious operation with guys who look like Secret Service agents with ear pieces in moving around like the president is coming. I was here on a Tuesday night with my produce and her daughter. These are two New Yorkers who know food and very well traveled. Our servers are very well versed in the menu and gave detailed descriptions But I could not hear them because it was so loud. Did I mention it's loud. The good news is the food is excellent. Insalats casa was excellent. More details to come but you will enjoy your dining experience. Our servers and Mallory and AJ were excellent. Very accommodating of our guest who has celiacs disease.

peCDQR_PDfGOE3MsIOAMuQ.text: Visited this restaurant about 2 years ago when they first opened.   Found the menu to be insanely overpriced for the portion sizes and staff pretentious.    Was pleased to learn there had been some menu revamping and my husband and I enjoyed a fabulous dinner last night.    Our server Jennifer was amazing and sommelier was great.  We never felt pushed to over order or select pricier options (which definitely happened the first go round). We split the charcuterie board which was a great selection and large portion.  We also had the green tortellini which was delicious!  And split the swordfish.   We found all flavor profiles to be spot on. Dinner was leisurely and appropriately priced.    I will be happy to go back for another evening out.  (More  of a date night or special occasion spot...)

uUKImlZExVaL9lPxDnR8eQ.text: We made a reservation at Fat Ox for our anniversary and had a delightful time.   The service was top notch all night long. They even gave us two complimentary glasses of prosecco and a card thanking us for celebrating with them. Our server was great and the manager seemed thoughtful and like he genuinely cared that we were having a good time.   We came hungry on purpose. We started off with the ricotta appetizer. First of all, we were questioning how you even get ricotta this good. Do they have to make a special trip to heaven? Just curious.   So, the ricotta is *whipped* with lemon zest, honey, and the nectar of the gods and then topped with marinated slivers of trumpet mushrooms, herbs, magic, and wrapped with prosciutto with some hidden flecks of hazelnuts. I mean. yes please. The only thing is, it would have been nice to have more bread to go with it all. But eating ricotta with a fork is fine too, I'm not judging.   Next up: Crab ravioli. These bite-sized pockets of love were accompanied by charred corn crumbles and some kind of sweet tomato(?) compote and lots of cute little sauces and radish slivers and pea tendrils or something. Order it, ignore the price tag. Indulge!   For our entrees, I chose the scallops and my date ordered the filet. Scallops are great because they're mysteriously buttery and tender and just ridiculous. They're such a luscious treat that I actually narrowed down my dinner location choices by restaurants that have scallops as entrees. So, three delicate and perfect scallops were sliced in half and served atop a pillow of sun choke puree (of which I entirely cleaned the plate), showered in brussels sprout leaves and marinated mushrooms, and I was in ecstasy.   I only had one bite of the filet, and the porcini mushroom sauce was on point. We ordered a side of the roasted mushrooms - which were delish - but had I known that they would be the same as the mushrooms with the scallops, I would've preferred something else. Their flavor is just a bit too bright to have a lot of all at once - I was expecting more of an earthy mushroom experience.   All in all, Fat Ox was wonderful and treated us super well for our anniversary!

aAqOxvIzUOFQ4G-WTeyidA.text: Back again. WOW 5 stars. The service does not stop. From opening the door to the table-side preparation of Caesar. WOW! Two person table service is on point! Scallops, 25 layer lasagna oh my. Avion 44 (top shelf Tequila) is impossible to find and they have an ample supply.

yLpIR4EFbd-cEcOkAszBCA.text: Just moved back to Oldtown Scottsdale. Thought I'd give this another try. I'm glad I did. I was greeted at the door my a friendly young woman. Nice!  Bartenders, especially Larry were super attentive and friendly. Ordered wine and the Happy Hour meatballs. Oh yum!!  Sorry about my previous review.

rQV4VvlTP-YfkiWSgH38Lw.text: Wonderful service and cute decor! Drinks were great, we ordered a few apps and then pasta and skipped out on the entrees since we were comfortably full. Pass on the Calabrian cauliflower, the mozzarella with the nduja was fantastic! Loved the gigli but the tortellini with ricotta was bland, although it was so pretty!

KQd_EFru7nSdOS7EmEaqrA.text: Amazing experience and food. I reserved a table for 8 and we were immediately seated and the service was incredible. We enjoyed a wonderful bottle of wine and terrific entrees. Our server was very supportive and spoke highly of the restaraunt and gave us some background info on the opening and what the focus has been, the changes over the years, etc. He was also a student at ASU and shared his feelings about our company and the table LOVED him! I can't speak highly enough about this warm and inviting dining experience. Go here. So worth it!

0iWrpblAXGX4-dndDJR15A.text: This place is all.....YUMMY.. OmG, the interior of the place was classy and it's small but every thing has a spot.    Let's start with the food..... WoooooooW! I ordered the salmon, can I say tender, light with skin seared cripsy...  it was swimming in a tomato and bean sauce which was so awesome I could've had it by itself.    The appetizer was a caesar salad with the old school anchovies salad dressing.... yes, finally a ceasar salad worth eating!  And the best thing of all was the dessert, a creamy tirimusi with a layer of chocolate at the bottom......woooooow!  I would definitely be back!

gVi6lypsZUpdCYMLHb-WLg.text: Had dinner here last weekend and had a wonderful experience. AJ our server provided excellent service as did the buss staff. Our food was very good. I had the filet which was cooked as requested with a very tasty mushroom sauce. My wife had the scallops which she said were awesome. We stated with the veal meatballs. I'd suggest you do the same if you go. Even the table bread was delicious! It is a pricy night out but we expected that and weren't disappointed with overall value. My only con was that we are brown liquor folks and found the pricing structure around some of the whiskeys and scotch head scratchers. $25 for Oban 14? Doesn't make sense, and not the only oddity. The Ox overall a keeper. Give it a try on for your next "nice" dinner date.

2scBsqhSKlL1Ty6C-nuZMw.text: Wow!! We're planning on dinner in Phoenix but had to meet halfway w/ friends visiting Scottsdale. Went to a couple of places but were put off by the 3 hour waits. We stumbled upon Fat Ox & what a great find! It's Saturday night & only tables available were on the heated patio. Great!!  The food was amazing & maybe one of the best Caesar salads ever!! Prepared table side by Cody & it was delish!! We each order one of the seafood options; grilled Salmon, Scallops  or Swordfish. We all were pleased w/ our selections.  I got the Swordfish & was so tasty, Seasoned w/ peppers, onions & sausage. Very nice!   The Dirty Martini  was divine, & kudos to the bartender! But it should be @ $20 per! What? I've never paid $20 for a martini! The hostess, Cheyenne was personable & aiming to please. Such a sweetheart & helpful too.   My Boo ordered 2 desserts, Tiramisu & Affagato. We had 4 spoons, a friend had joined us for dessert. I love Tiramisu but this was different than any I've tasted. It was too sweet & sticky. I'm use to creamy & smooth. The Affagato, think Italian float, ice cream & espresso, was super.    The other criticism was our waiter Anthony who lacked follow thru. We saw Cody more. I had to ask another waiter for a cocktail.  We still left a 20% tip.

qoS_HFeAzKrmsA4kIc0APw.text: We had an interesting dinner at Fat Ox the other night...  The rave reviews and accolades brought us in.  Our server was terrific, very personable and helpful in ordering as he steered me to what he thought I would like best on the menu based on my preferences.   I'm not sure what steak I had for my main but it was delicious as was the mussels starter with a scrumptious tomato broth. Most of our table seemed quite satisfied with their meals with the exception of one dish. A pasta selection that was supposed to have truffles on it, possibly as an add on.  When the tray of our mains came out to the table the person delivering the food turned around and went back in the kitchen.  It was a bit of time and then they returned.  After tasting the pasta, my friend, who is a chef and owner of a catering business, asked where the truffles were on her dish.  The server apologized and said that the dish had dropped coming out of the kitchen and that was the last of the truffles that they had.  They offered to bring some truffle oil/butter on the side and did.  For this caliber of restaurant, that was unacceptable to me.  We were having a great time and enjoying the company at our table and just let it go.  However, I feel the restaurant should have 1. Offered her to select an alternate dish before they served the table, or 2. Most certainly should have let her know before she had to ask and also comped her entree.    On their behalf, they may have given us some dessert gratis, however, if it was, we were never told and I believe some of our party ordered from the restaurant week menu anyway which would have included dessert.  With a party of 6 and 3 bottles of wine, things got a bit hazy by the end of the meal!  Nevertheless, overall the food was very good and the service - aside from our mishap - was exceptional.

OYVx_zOUP65rcVnZ0AFWIA.text: Very Classy spot. Beautiful Modern Restaurant.  We ordered: Tableside Caesar. Crest Di Gallo w/ Duck Sausage, Mushroom & Huckleberries. Radiatori w Pork Sugo, Broccolini, Tomato, Ricotta Salata & Pesto. Tiramisu. Affogato.  Everything was pretty delicious. The service was excellent.  Would definitely return!

b2uVOTNlpuMODqdsq7071Q.text: We had a fantastic date night/celebratory dinner this evening. Brent the GM, AJ our server, and the entire team was on point! Our meal was well executed and the tiramisu was the perfect, sweet finish. I would recommend this establishment to any of my friends who want a fun girls night or a great splurge meal. Thanks for the wonderful experience, we'll see you soon!

xq58d7OdhWuUaeIrBSjv0Q.text: AZ Restaurant Week enticed my dining partner and I to try this trendy hot spot. LOVED IT! We had Opentable 7:30 Saturday reservations. When we arrived we were greeted and seated right away. Canteen R was our excellent server, explaining all the new and existing dishes being offered.  We started off with cocktails: a Cosmo which was excellent and Martinis. We chose to dine off the AZ Restaurant week menu choosing the Tagliatelle, Scallop Crudo, Jidori Chicken, Skirt Steak, ending with the Pistachio Gelato and the Panna Cotta. There was a mix up in drinks and we were offered the Cauliflower side and a comped Cosmo.  The food was wonderful, excellent Tagliatelle and Scallops. The Chicken came with this tangy hot sauce... so good. The skirt steak done to my ordered medium rare. I will say I am not a fan of the new cauliflower trend, but the comped dish made me try and OMG I'm a lover now. The Pistachio Gelato was excellent. The weakest dish was my Panna Cotta dessert.  Great dining experience, I'm glad I tried on the  AZ Restaurant Week. A bit pricey especially cocktails, but it won't deter me from coming back though.  Atmosphere: Trendy, Service: excellent, Food: excellent.

9yBO8pyrOfMW1IQbHeZHDQ.text: Our first time here. Beautiful space, great service (AJ), and the good was outstanding. I'm a polenta fanatic so whenever I see it on a menu I order it. My wife had the papardelle, also wonderful. She had the short rib... expertly cooked and the smoked mushrooms are something I will have to try at home! I had the Linz steak, Long Island cut. I thought it was sous vide, but it was just cooked and seasoned perfectly. One of the best steaks I've ever had. The gelatos (amaretto and pistachio)... let's just say "bravo"! One thing I would like to know is, where can I get a set of those steak knives?

4oDRV2QJQdsyMCQQSr2FJQ.text: I highly recommend Fat Ox for private dining. We hosted a customer dinner for 40 in the Rosso Room. I'm the company admin booking the event. The restaurant staff were very professional. I worked with two event managers (Tamara and Heather) and two servers, and everyone was experienced and top of their game.   We had a 30-minute reception followed by dinner. The event manager met guests at the restaurant entrance and led them to the private dining room, where a server handed them a glass of Prosecco sparkling wine. There were also passed appetizers, and a wine and water station (with a server) with Prosecco and our red and white wines. I'd asked them to have the first (appetizer) course on the tables when people are seated, so they brought that out at our dinner start time, which was a good transition for people to move to the tables. Everything went so smoothly and the staff had perfect timing and professional demeanor.   I did not stay for dinner but I've been to the restaurant a few times and the food is really good. :) I heard good feedback that everyone enjoyed the business dinner.

31VppOZfK4EuTgo19GG9vA.text: This is a wonderful restaurant for just about any special occasion. I dined here recently with a large group and we were fortunate enough to have the back private room reserved for our dinner. The wine was a-plenty and flowing upon arrival! I felt bad for the staff because initially we came in all at once (just about) and they seemed a little overwhelmed. Drinks from the bar took a little while but I don't blame them because a) the size of our group b) it was happy hour/dinner time.   The pre-selected white wine was delicious and paired well with our family-style meal. Appetizers included the house cauliflower (to die for!), insalata di casa, and an amazing charcuterie board. Our main course plates were gigli, short rib, scallops, and chicken, of which the scallops and chicken I think were the best-liked in our group and for myself. The polenta was so delicious that they brought more bowls of it. There were other sides, but not as memorable. We had a chef's selection for dessert and I'm glad I picked the panna cotta - you cannot go wrong with that at an Italian-inspired restaurant.   My hat's off to the chef for creating an inspiring menu and for the team at Fat Ox for a great evening!

-o4UZHd-pmFipqCTwMtlcA.text: Poor service over priced food. Bartender didn't look at us the entire time we were there.  He didn't present the happy hour menu so we paid full price for our drinks.  We were empty even though we like to have our drinks.  The food ok not great, fine, but a real lack of service.

ruUU4P7BJIm6GL6iA6vxKg.text: Great ambience, but food is very average. $18-$20 pasta dishes are pretty basic and nothing extraordinary. Caesar salad, Linguine and Scallops were just ok, nothing I'd go back for. Ambience is fun and lively, but much better food can be found elsewhere.

P0P0zTFHeSCXD2-HRw5aFQ.text: $5 valet when every place in town is free? Really? Anyways - onto the inside.. Slower service than expected, couldn't believe a 7:00 reservation for restaurant week had us finally leaving at after 9:30. Table side Caesar salad - great idea however we were asked if we were ok with several ingredients that were not even in the salad. Where was the cheese, garlic, pepper? Disappointment. It was very hard to converse at our table, the volume inside was so loud. Drinks took ages, the place was not that busy. All in all, there are better places that are cheaper that offer much better service.

32xRUWkTqkXJdexwDwstYg.text: Superb! My friend and I had several excellent small plates. I was so impressed with their gluten free pasta dish. Filet and scallops outstanding! Bartender, Jonathan, rocked! Service and ambiance totally high caliber.

qETMQiR_wuWRxTY7kpyaaw.text: Went on a Sunday night for girls night out.  4 of us had a wonderful time.   Foods were great.   The pastas and steak were delicious.  We finished with tiramisu.  I have to mention our waitress (I wish I remember her name) was fantastic.  She is so friendly with a sense of humor!  She recommended us one of the red wine.  We opened a bottle and ended up getting two more glasses.  I will def go back again.

-lm6LNll8eyZU-jazIeXgA.text: After a long decision making process, my party decided to attend Fat Ox for Restaurant Week Spring 17. I mean, this is a big deal for us: we all consider ourselves foodies and are 'well-eaten' haha. Anyway, we arrived promptly for our reservation excited to try out the menu we had previously perused.  Immediately upon entering the door we got the impression from the hostesses that we were putting them out. The hostess at the desk looked me up and down, without a smile on her face, and gave a simple "Hello". I did not feel welcome at all though proceeded to give her the details of our reservation.  We received a similar reception by our waiter, particularly once we told him that we were there for Restaurant Week. After this, we were told they were out of the Hangar Steak, which several members of our 8 person party had already decided upon. They were not offering any substitutions for this item. I began to feel regretful about this choice of restaurant, especially since I had pushed for Fat Ox and made the reservation myself. For the remainder of the evening, service from the waiter was very slow. The waiter assistant, however, was actually very kind and on top of things.       On to the food. I ordered the Cavatelli as my appetizer. This was good except for the pieces of hen that were a bit chewy/grissly. The corn was a nice, sweet foil to the saltier pasta. The Jidori chicken was the star of the show, very flavorful and tender. The accompanying polenta was very creamy, and I appreciated the addition of the side sauces. I tried a friend's sea bass and was underwhelmed, as there was not much flavor. I had the affogato for dessert, which was yummy, though more like espresso with a lot of thick whipped cream on top than a traditional affogato. It was served with a side doughnut dipped in a very rich dark chocolate.   Bottom Line: Even though the food was tasty, it did not make up for the way we were treated. Many restaurants, on RW and otherwise, have much better offerings for similar prices with much better service. We will not be back. Two stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. RW Cavatelli pasta appetizer
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jidori Chicken, including polenta and sauces

y-A9a92T1OSiVR1eq2PB0g.text: Who on earth do you think you are? Decent cocktails. ALL the rest is so average & disgraceful. Nothing of the elegance of Italy, over cooked pasta and the prices. Scottsdale at its finest. Appalling. And the sound.. your hipster architect has no idea how to buffer sound? C'mon I can't hear myself think about how I'm wishing I was anywhere but here!

OKOEX-mhkipDMeRSfxw2RA.text: The food was good, but this place is in my do not return list. Second visit, got to give a place a chance, both times the atmosphere was terrible. You can't have a conversation, the place is so noisy you might as well be in a night club. The pictures of naked women in the men's bathroom was what put me over the top. I won't ever go back.

xY91IJYA_6iofSPr8sREhQ.text: Have been in town visiting from Chicago for two different bachelorettes. For the first, I recommended it after hearing about the 25 Layer lasagna! We had a large group, about 13 and overall felt food, service and ambiance were all great. That said, I recommended it once again to the next bachelorette group that I was returning with two weeks later. We showed up on time for our 8P reservation but were not seated until about 8:40. Our group was fine to sit outside and have a cocktail (which were on point btw!) while we waited for the table.. as a server, I get that you can't hustle out a large party even if you want to! When we got to the table, we were greeted with flutes of champagne which was a nice touch given that we are all there celebrating and the table was running behind. Honestly, all was pretty great- loved the chicken we shared and the charcuterie board and the wine we had (I want to say Juggernaut but not positive?).  However- the only thing that kind of soured the experience was at the end... we paid our $450 dollar bill, left a generous tip and then as we're about to leave the waiter comes up and said he forgot to charge us for our wine and that he needs to reswipe my card. obviously, we ordered said bottle, we weren't trying to skimp out on not paying but if you are not attentive and observant enough to your checks that you are leaving off a $65 dollar item- that is on you to eat. As i said, I'm a server and have been there before and it would be an unfortunate thing I would have to cough up because it's my mistake which is what I feel should have been the case. All of us felt it was a little weird to have to reswipe my card/retip but in general, did love the food and experience and would go back if I were in town again.

niXx-b6mJBQt9J7kSx2LuA.text: Was there with friends last night. All of us for the first time. We have worked through all the best the valley seems to have to offer and this place left me speechless.  Each course perfect. Service exceptional. I don't know if you can find better pasta without getting on an airplane and the secondi was perfecto.  If you go and don't get pasta, you've missed out. And the pork chop was the best of my life.  In a word, craveable.

pRTjsrznRR6R2VYWY87kjQ.text: First and foremost, the service blew me away. Our waiter literally gave us a tour of the kitchens/dining areas and had the menu memorized to a tee. He later prepared the most delicious Caesar salad right in front of us.   The modern Italian style of the restaurant promotes a small dish, mix & match concept, meaning that the four of us ordered several dishes (2 pastas and 2 meats), from which we took food to our individual plates. As a little shrimp in a big world, that freedom to experiment and try everything really appealed to me. Not only that, but the food tasted incredible!!   When dessert time rolled around, my friend Bartholomew began saying that this may be the greatest meal he's ever had. Our waiter then brought us a trio of his favorite desserts, of which the tiramisu was breathtaking. I'm a tiramisu fanatic, and I kid you not that it was the best I've ever had. (The waiter didn't even charge us for one of the desserts, and his startling kindness makes me think that he's a beautiful merman of sorts.)   Bottom line: If you want to splurge and try something different, swim over to the Fat Ox and have a mouthwatering time.  Tl; dr: The tiramisu saved me from this cold, harsh world and taught me to live to my fullest potential.

ikNTixV-9Acj1kGbJWcGOQ.text: I have wanted to try his restaurant for a long time. Very nice place. We had the Cesar salad very good flavor different.  Pasta is excellent. We had the porterhouse it is huge.  Far too much for four people Sean and Amanda did a great job.  He was training her.  She will be good at this as well.  Kudos all around.  The big negative is very low lighting.  I asked the server about this.    He said the manager likes it that way.   Perhaps it would be a good idea to ask your customers.

XOe-76dGFSG2T1cj2PvPVg.text: After eying Fat Ox for quite a bit, I finally decided to try it out with a girlfriend from out-of-town. I am endlessly glad we did! The staff was beyond amazing, everyone from the host who found us seating in the packed restaurant to the servers who were courteous and professional. The owner even threw in a bottle of champagne for us! If that's not treating you guests right, I don't know what is. Finally, the food. We had a sampling of five different pastas and could not choose a favorite. The flavors were unique and an adventure for the tastebuds. Above par experience! Thank you Fat Ox!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Bp9zulR5F8PzPau36Mw72A.text: I tried pretty much everything, It was all Amazing! Sexy atmosphere to boot!  chef board, Caesar, Gigli pasta, filet, French press coffee, olive oil cake, lemon tart , and pistachio gelato. Yup! Almost every was tried. And all deserving of 5 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Lz5i6LZx6uvja8kowk2I5Q.text: I found our experience at Fat Ox to be a mixed bag. The highlight is really the restaurant itself . The decor and the ambiance is fantastic. Clean and modern. The bar area is very well done. As for the food, the Rigatoni Lamb Verde is outstanding, the meats and cheeses are ok, the short rib was very good, and the scallops were good as well.  There are some low lights though... The place is very loud, the prices are up there (our dinner for 4 came in at close to $400 (without the wine)), the portions are small, and the desserts are  mediocre (our lemon tart lacked any lemon flavor).   Overall, would I eat here again? I am not really sure. I love the look and feel, but I was not really taken in by food.   N*joy...

MDY_WjtTuz3YN-6ZVCGXuQ.text: I was introduced to the Fat Ox last night for the 2017 NYE celebration with a lovely prix fixe menu.   Our reservation was for 7pm - early enough in the evening to relax through each course and savor our food. And that we did for the first 3!   We were ushered in warmly, like family, and seated in a back dining room, which had a nice, intimate feeling.  From the prix fixe menu, I selected the table side Caesar salad, green tortellini, the Creekside filet, and the Meyer lemon tart.  The Caesar salad is made to order at your table, and they take into consideration all your preferences - if you're squirrelly about raw eggs, don't want anchovies, etc. My salad was perfect - the lettuce was crisp, dressing was tangy yet not overpowering, and dressed perfectly.   The tortellini, too, was flavorful. The pasta was al dente, ricotta filling creamy but not watery, and the presentation was beautiful - colorful & tempting.  My filet was cooked just as I'd requested - medium. It was tender and juicy. The porcini cream and gravy enhanced the flavored of the meat nicely. Everyone was happy with their main courses, except one if us, who ordered the short ribs. (She felt that although the seasoning and glaze was flavorful, the meat was rubbery - it wouldn't cut.) Our other friend, who ordered the guinea hen, loved her meal.  I liked the ambiance as a whole. Up to our receiving our main plates, our service was lovely - the delivery of our food was timed perfectly, the waitstaff attentive but not intrusive, etc. All the accoutrements made for a lovely experience - flatware had a nice weight, lighting felt warm & inviting, there are a lot of airy & open spaces, and the decor a blend of old & new.  As we were savoring our main courses, the live band began their first set. It seemed out of nowhere that the volume in the back dining room exploded - it was simply too loud. My table mates & I couldn't hear those sitting next to us in conversation, and there was no option to speak to anyone across the table, as the volume was too loud. We had to repeat ourselves in conversation constantly (none of us have hearing issues.)  After five or so songs, the lead singer began belting out Jennifer Hudson-like notes, which unfortunately weren't delivered as Jennifer Hudson would.  Nevertheless, the music could've been digestible had it simply been lower in volume.  Sadly, the music volume shifted the tone on our entire dining experience. After serving the first 3 courses and being perfectly attentive, our server went missing. It became apparent why - although we'd preordered our desserts at 7:30, they'd somehow sold out. Three of us ordered the Meyer lemon tarts (evidently most people eating last night did!), one ordered the olive oil cake, and the last ordered the tiramisu.  I assume our server didn't know how to mitigate the issue, thus opted to ignore us until we asked where our desserts were. Finally the olive oil cake and tiramisu were delivered, but with extra random, small bowls of gelato. As she delivered these desserts, our server did not acknowledge our missing tarts, thus we sat there looking at the gelato in confusion and disinterest. The three of us who'd pre-ordered the tarts finally flagged another server down (ours went missing again,) to inquire the status of our promised desserts.   So, as we sat perplexed in the status of our tarts, those who received the cake & tiramisu shared theirs.  The tiramisu was very good - the person in our party who ordered it, loved it. The olive oil cake was dense. The taste and texture reminded me more of a bread than a cake. It was served with orange gelato, which helped offset the density, while also add some much needed flavor. I think I'd have liked the olive oil cake if it had been made with citrus peel. But without such a pop of flavor, the cake to me, tasted too bland.  We were also promised an Amaro in the prix fixe menu, which didn't come until we inquired about its status.   In the end, the gelato sat almost untouched - I tasted them just to test the flavors. There was pistachio, espresso, and amaretto. Pistachio is my favorite gelato, but this one had a faint, almost indistinguishable pistachio flavor, which is a shame. The amaretto, too, wasn't strong, but the espresso was very distinguishable. The gelato was definitely rich & creamy, but alas, I'm not a fan of gelato in the wintertime.  So, the latter half of the evening felt as though we were micromanaging the delivery of an agreed-to contract and being placated with boring alternatives. That's unfortunate, because the first half of the dinner was delightfully phenomenal.  We chalked the negative experiences up to their being a new restaurant, and not yet having worked out their kinks. The bad news is that what went wrong, was handled sophomorically. But the great news is that they got half the evening more than right. And in the end, I'll go back for that Caesar alone.

q00N0ZjWBSkN5wSAdeWWzA.text: Had dinner here just before Christmas and wasn't impressed.  Portions were weak, way overpriced and lighting was too dim.  Plus it was way too loud.  Facebook was right about this place. Will stay w/ Village Inn or Buca Di Beppo for the time being.

mVvVh2fcqI2RM1DxhrSklw.text: So where do I begin, disappointment doesn't fully describe our experience. We were a party of four.  The waiter explained that the portions weren't "overly large", he was somewhat correct but he should have said they were absurdly small. I don't often leave a restaurant hungry and thinking where can I stop on the way home for a quick bite.   The waiter explained that we should share the meals, but order a number of courses, which is what we did.     We started with a Ceasar Salad, it was very good but small in size , our second course was an order of Barrata cheese, which also was very tasty.  Our third course was pasta, we ordered a Cavatelli with chicken, there was barely two tablespoons of past.  Absurd,  I believe it was $18 and was supposed to be a main course and was barely an appetizer size.  Our fourth course was Flank Steak., $35,  they first brought out steak knives that you could use to butcher the ox with, and then out came the steak. Eight or so thin strips of steak,  I mean thin, it would have been laughable if I wasn't paying for it.   The atmosphere was very nice, and all the dishes were very tasty and well done.  The place was packed tonight but my guess is that they'll be out of business in six months. No Ox got fat eating here.

7gJIHiHJ2CSfBl90PZJIVQ.text: This was the best meal we ate on a 5 day food tour. Do yourself a favor and skip the main entree, try the fresh pastas and dessert menu.

aMsFcNoakn-OqsPZmBVwiw.text: This restaurant has excellent food.  Compliments the the chef.  The lower rating is due to the noise level. It is so noisy, difficult to even have pleasant conversation at your table.  Don't go if you want to enjoy the company.  Even the back room is cavernous and noise just bounces everywhere.

XmtiRx-3DtlaL6sjViw3ew.text: Our first night in Scottsdale we wanted a nice dinner and Fat Ox did not disappoint.  Lovely decor, new and modern.  Our server was fantastic, very attentive and helpful.  Not only was he knowledgeable of the menu he gave us a list of places bars and clubs to check out while we were in town.  We had reservation for 8pm.  We were still waiting for a couple of girls to arrive from the airport, we never felt rushed.  We ended up closing the place down.   We started with table side Caesar salad. Loved it.  Fresh and that dressing so yummy! And who doesn't enjoy table side service.   For dinner I shared 2 types of pasta with one of the other ladies.  We tried the garganille pasta and resso crest di gallo.  Both tasted fantastic.  Daily house made pasta was perfectly made and the sauce was not overly powering.  The garganille was my fave, it was a light cream sauce.  Being in a group of 7 you get to try other food that people ordered.  I had a bite of the swordfish, was delish!  Made me wish I ordered it.  Veal meatball was on the dry side, overall ok.  And the affettati misti, so rich!! That my friend ended up getting a lighter entree.   Overall, we had a great time, service and food! We would go back if we were back in Scottsdale.

1HEhkmQozsFIm1ZTHrYOCw.text: This place was amazing. I want to come here for every special occasion in the future! I was so impressed with everything, from start to finish.   My friend and I made a reservation via OpentTable for 7:30PM on a Saturday night. The only option was for counter seating, but I had placed a request for an actual table if possible. When we checked in with the hostesses they acknowledged our request and said we could have an actual table.   The restaurant was slammed, but the timeliness of everything was perfect. Our server was amazing and timed each interaction perfectly. I wish I could remember her name! She was very refined and we could tell she had been a server for quite some time.   She recommended this homemade pasta appetizer to us which was AMAZING. It melted in my mouth and the flavor was perfect. I would go back just for that! Then I had a steak and my friend had salmon. Everything was perfect. I have no complaints whatsoever.  The ambience is very cool with dark lighting and candles. It's definitely underrated and I 100% recommend giving them a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AHRLz7BH9QnaHRKt4NOe3g.text: A little pricey for Italian, but I was pleased with the dinner I had here last night. I agree with other reviewers that the serving sizes were just right - not too large, but not laughably small. I was thoroughly impressed by the bar where I ordered a Oak Barrel Aged Manhattan (very good) to start the evening off. For dinner I had the scallops - definitely would recommend.  My only complain, which is small, is that the restaurant was very loud. At a table of four, only one of us were able to hear our evidently soft-spoken waitress, so much so that we opted to have one person order all of our appetizers for us because we couldn't hear the explanation of the menu - at all. I actually had a hard time hearing the hostess too. I might not go back here for a work dinner again for this reason.

22irY30nBYuVGHyK1BYrIQ.text: Another easy five star for me. The ambiance was incredible. So much natural lighting and nice decor. The starting house bread comes with a spicy butter spread which is incredible. I then got the meat and cheese board which was delicious. I only ordered pasta for my Main dish which was a bit small but I wasn't too hungry. I got the Gigli and I savored every single bite. I can't imagine anything on the menu not being incredible. Our waitress was so outgoing and kind. Great spot!

9cYAF21mV2cC4PFXIOg6iw.text: Ewww...I'm not impressed at all.  The yelp page says they open at 4:30pm so shortly after I arrived with a small group only to be told to sit at the bar only because the restaurant wouldn't be opening for at least 30 minutes.  Okay but one friend had a small child and therefore couldn't sit in the bar so we sat in our cars waiting 30 minutes.  This was dumb and we should've left but we wanted pasta so we stayed.  The waiter was trying waaayyy too hard to impress and as soon as he walked away another server was much friendly easier to communicate with and suggested some dishes.  Our waiter returned and took our order.  Based on yelp photos I went with the table side Caesar and a cheese dish and the grilled shrimp.  Umm the salad was okay but nothing special, the grilled shrimp was ice cold and not that great either, and the cheese came as a small salad - wtf?!  Okay onto entrees we all wanted pasta and selected a few to try.  My friend went ahead and also got the scallops.  All in all the pasta again was "okay" and nothing special. The final bill was $400 for 6 adults who had the apps listed above and pasta and only two had a cocktail...wow what a joke. $400 for mediocre food that's trying to hard.  The sad thing is I heard about this restaurant from the Andaz who also shows a tv commercial on the welcome channel showing the amazing pasta...no idea where the disconnect is but having experienced Pasta around the world and some of the most amazing Michelin star pasta dishes this place is a waste of money.  Honestly Olive Garden would have been more filling, faster service, better overall and for a fraction of the price.  It's rare when I regret the entire meal, calories, money, etc.

1jHDE0R2nM0sj6QvhAoUQg.text: If there was a 4.5 option I would have selected that. We really enjoyed our Friday night dinner here. This is a good Happy Hour and date spot as the noise level is relatively low and lighting and atmosphere was nice.  I'm Celiac and need gluten-free options free from cross-contamination & they were very accommodating. We both got the Gigli pasta as a pasta starter (mine was gluten-fee penne), and both really liked the flavor as it had good tomato and basil flavor to it.    For dinner I went with the short rib and was quite good with the side of polenta.  The pomegranate molasses sauce they put on the short rib had a lot of flavor. My wife got the chicken and it was very good. Both meals with gluten-free (if you remove the tortilla from the chicken plate).  The hot sauce that came with the chicken was very good! It was relatively hot and have a good peppery flavor to it.  We both had dessert as well. I had the pistachio gelato without the crumble and it was phenomenal, highly recommend it!  My wife got the chocolate tart and was happy with. She said you needed to be in the mood for something chocolatey but if you are, this would be a good choice.  We'll be back again likely on another date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and it was quite good
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Caramelized onions &amp; sauces that came with the chicken - hot sauce was very good!
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Short rib - gluten-free and good flavor

P5VTgHBIFQjRYiohcBOJZA.text: To start off the food here is absolutely delicious. The portions are just the right size & you honestly get a good serving. My boyfriend and I got a few dishes and shared them so we could try multiple things.  The table side Caesar salad is amazing, I definitely recommend getting this it is like no other. We also got the veal meatballs, half chicken, tortellini pasta & steak with mushrooms. All were outstanding and I would highly recommend all however I'm positive everything on the menu is delicious.   The real reason I'm writing this review is because of the service. I am from out of state and do not have my I.D flipped so they were unable to serve me a drink , completely understandable. Most places would say sorry and continue the service ,  but not here. The manager along with our servers Scott and Anthoney were very apologetic and even served me a non alcoholic cocktail to make up for it, they then put in a pasta dish that was one of their favorites which is now our favorite and brought out a dessert for us at the end. The service was amazing and it truly made our night how attentive they were to us and how personable the manager is.  If they do see this review we want to say thank you for a great dinner service! We will continue to choose Fat Ox for all of our special dates because the food is unreal and the service is there to match it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zrdGmxmM0nDTUw_dYhBcJg.text: Came here with a group so we made reservations a head of time. They explained that usually people get a bunch of plates and then share. We got a couple of the apps (inducing the table side Caesar) but overall we all wanted pasta so we all just ordered our own then shared those.  I went with the truffle pasta and it was wonderful, as well as were all the other pasta dishes I tried. The ambiance was great and so was the service. I would definitely go back!

JY15ybj7NXWc2r-pon6ewA.text: Love this place-- great happy hour special and drinks. My coworker and I split a few small plates together and were very satisfied and full.   I was impressed with the aesthetic of each plate and the details that went into making each look beautiful. We had a few crostinis to share with burrata and prosciutto.         Great ambiance that can be tricky to find in Scottsdale.

oXexQDZmLcqhYng6asugGg.text: Maybe I am just on an Italian food kick, but recently I have been lucky enough to visit a couple of the greatest Italian food restaurants in the Valley.  I had driven by the Fat Ox plenty of times before, before, but I had never stopped inside.  Fortunately, this Friday night I was hungry, with my family, and the restaurant had an open table: we decided to step inside.  Now we did not know what to expect from the food, other than that it was a spin on Italian food. I would consider it a more modern take on Italian food. Not modern in a "weird food combination way" but modern in a "here is a spicy and seasoned olive oil" kind of way. I started with the Caesar for two made at the table. The crispiness of the lettuce paired well with the taste of anchovy and the parmesan created a wonderful taste.   I couldn't decide between the steak or the 25-layer lasagna (you read that right, 25!).  I decided to go for the lasagna, how could I not?  Interesting enough, it is not an Instagram-bait portion. It's a very reasonably sized slice that is laid down on its side and covered in roasted broccoli. The lasagna had a sweet and savory flavor to it, not Grandma's lasagna, but delicious in its own right.  Now my only criticism of the entire restaurant was that the broccoli used as garnish was roasted directly over a gas stove and just had a tinge of gas taste in it. Not enough to mar the rest of the meal, but definitely noticeable.  The dessert was delicious; I would definitely recommend the tiramisu as you can never go wrong with a good tiramisu at an Italian restaurant. The lemon cake was also incredibly refreshing on a hot summer day, but it was incredibly tart, so make sure you are ready!

qoxrgveMtxVG0a55UVgXkA.text: Amazing spot. Great atmosphere. Extremely delicious modern Italian dishes. Tableside Ceasar is a must!!! This place came highly recommended and they did not disappoint!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Fat Ox - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

XpgXdI5aGe78OO4VPAgvzA.text: Whoa. Wowza. To say we had an amazing meal would be an understatement. Fat Ox was recommended by our concierge and I could not recommend it to everyone in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area enough. When making reservations you can choose between a high top (bar area) or tabletop (dining area). We chose the bar area with the wonderful window wall. And the food. Oh the food. Unique and classic Italian all at the same time. The food will knock your socks off! The cesar salad was one of the best I've had- perfectly salty and cheesy and tangy. I opted for the anchovies but you can order without. The charcuterie tray was well balanced with a little of everything you want in your meats and cheeses. The pasta was fresh and you can tell. I picture a sweet Italian grandma making it in the back and apparently it's not far from the truth! I tend to order and affogato after a delicious meal and this was no exception. But it's an affogato with a side of donut hole. Yeah. It was a lot.

aLhuLL76_oJmPPvitXItTw.text: Delicious meal at The Fat Ox. We shared Burata and salad for appetizer and both were wonderful. Not the beat Buratta I've eaten, but very nice.  We both had the scallops for main and they were possibly the beat scallops we have ever eaten. Holy smokes they were good!  We also had the tiramisu and lemon tart for dessert. They were both very good (tiramisu was better if you're going to pick just one). Wine selection is great and service was super attentive, just a little too quick for us. They brought our main dishes before we were quite finished with appetizer... that was the only issue that kept it from 5 stars (we felt rushed).

0XJZChli1VnmQqudw9XN-g.text: The atmosphere here is really nice, I love the bar area with the high top seating which is in a glass area. Reminds me of a glass gazebo. The food is really good and cooked perfect. Good size portions. We came for restaurant week which is a good deal. The staff was welcoming and very helpful. Overall I can't wait to go back and try for food.

OXFCbW2hVlKupoK6exzVXA.text: Finally got a chance to have dinner here. It is now my favorite Italian restaurant in town.  We made a reservation for 9 pm. The restaurant is high end. Staff is extremely friendly and nice.  My wife kept her hand bag on the floor and one of the staff promptly ran over with a towel to put under it.  The food was great. They are known for their table side Caesar salad which was amazing. The shrimp and mussels were amazing as well. The pasta which we got to share was delicious. For the entree I got the rib eye which was tender and delicious.  We were too stuffed and did not try the dessert.  This is a great place for a nice dinner. Do plan on spending money when your here.

crSDUcwHnvhStT66MGKmLQ.text: Everything was delicious! The table side Caesar salad was very fresh and tasty the handmade pastas were perfectly flavored and cooked, the short rib and steak were soft and tender! Definitely recommend this place!
